column3: The institution of serfdom -- unfree farm labour tied to the land of a local noble, effectively a form of feudal slavery -- had existed in various forms in Russia since the Kievan Rus of the 11th century. Throughout the ages the institution had undergone several reforms and changes, but the first steps toward a complete abolishment were taken only in the 1810s, when the institution was abolished in the Russian domains of Kurland, Estonia and Livonia. The institution was only abolished in all of Russia with the agrarian reform of 1861, during the reign of Tsar Alexander II, who at the time feared that the Russian peasantry might otherwise seek their liberation through outright revolution.

column3: Although one of the more active members of Schmoller's Verein, Wagner actually supported Menger in the Methodenstreit. His work on public finance is what he is best known for in economics. column3: Alfred Adler was an Austrian doctor and psychtherapist. Adler diverged from Freud in arguing that unconscious motivation could be better explained by teleological goals rather than instinctual drives. According to Adler, people are born with a feeling of Inferiority. People attempt to overcome these feelings of inferiority. Adler posited one of three outcomes. An 'inferiority complex' develops in people who are overwhelmed by these feelings. Some of these will develop a superiority complex to mask their true feelings. Psychologically healthy people manifest the concept of self-esteem and satsify their goals through a sense of personal achievement.

column2: 알프레드 비네는 지능의 개인적인 차이를 측정하기 위해 표준화된 시험의 사용을 개척한 프랑스 심리학자입니다. 프랑스 정부는 1899년 비네와 그의 제자 테오도르 시몬에게 '지체된' 아이들과 '정상적인' 아이들을 구별하기 위한 시험의 개발을 의뢰했습니다. 시몬-비네식 시험은 지능을 여러 영역으로 나누어 측정했습니다. 더 높은 능력을 측정하기 위해 고려된 질문들은 그들의 교사들이 높게 평가한 학생들이 더 자주 대답한 질문들입니다. 비네는 또한 지능은 물려받지만 교육에 의해 즉흥적으로 만들어질 수 있다고 믿었습니다. 그의 시험은 각 과목의 시험 결과에 따라 하나의 '정신 수준' 점수를 부여했습니다.
column4: Alfred Binet was a French psychologist who pioneered the use of standardized testing to measure individual differences in intelligence. The French government commissioned Binet and his student Theodore Simon to develop a test in 1899 to differentiate 'retarded' from 'normal' children. The Simon-Binet test divided intelligence into several areas and measured each with a battery of questions. Questions considered to measure higher ability were those answered more often by students whom their teachers had rated highly. Binet also believed that intelligences were inherited, but improvable by education. His test assigned a single 'mental-level' score to each subject based on their test results.

column2: '경제자립정책'은 고대 그리스어로 자급자족을 뜻하는 'Autarky'에서 유래됐습니다. 20세기 초, 많은 국가들은 세계경제에 대한 과도한 의존이 국가의 독립과 체제의 이념적 기초를 위태롭게 한다고 여겨 자급자족경제를 지향했습니다. 강대국들은 자급자족경제를 실현하기 위해 수입품에 고관세를 부과하고, 국내 산업을 장려하거나 국민소득을 지키기 위해 대외 무역에 엄격한 규제를 마련하기도 했습니다. 자국에서 생산하지 않아 국제무역으로 조달해야 하는 중요한 자원에 대해서도 대체자원 등의 연구 개발이 적극적으로 이루어졌습니다. 이 때문에 자급자족경제를 실현하기 위해서 행해진 각종정책은 '20세기에 되살아난 중상주의'로 비난받았습니다. 생산에 관해 자본주의를 완전히 혹은 부분적으로 배제한 공산주의나 파쇼주의 국가들이 종종 이 체제를 채용하기도 했습니다. 다만 자본주의 국가, 특히 중요한 자원을 자급할 수 있는 거대한 식민제국의 경우는 경기가 불안정한 시기에 자급자족 경제체제 요소를 도입했습니다.
column3: Derived from the Ancient Greek for self-sufficiency, in the early twentieth century autarky was the goal for many States that felt further dependence upon the global economy was a threat to their national independence or the ideological basis of their regimes. In order to achieve autarky, such states would impose huge tariff barriers to imports from overseas, encourage the development of local industries to produce goods previously imported, strictly regulate foreign trade to preserve national income, and investigate the development of alternative substitutes to critical raw materials that were not available to the nation except from the world market. As an economic policy autarky could be called a twentieth-century revision of mercantilism, and while most often used by Communist and Fascist regimes that rejected all or part the capitalist model of economic production, even capitalist nations would resort to elements of autarky in times of economic instability, especially if they controlled large overseas empires that could provide key raw materials.
column5: Autarkie ist vom altgriechischen Wort f쬦 Selbstst쬦digkeit abgeleitet. Anfang des zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts war die Autarkie das Ziel vieler Staaten, die der Ansicht waren, dass eine noch gr秤ere Abh쬦gigkeit von der Weltwirtschaft ihre nationale Unabh쬦gigkeit oder die ideologischen Basis ihrer Regimes bedrohen k쬦nte. Zur Erreichung von Autarkie erhoben solche L쬦der riesige Einfuhrz쬦le auf 쬦ersee-Importe, womit die Entwicklung einer lokalen Industrie beg쬦stigt wurde, um die vormals importierten G쬦er vor Ort herzustellen. Auch der Au쬦nhandel wurde stark eingeschr쬦kt, um das nationale Einkommen zu sch쬦zen und zudem die Erforschung von Ersatzmaterialien f쬦 wichtige Rohmaterialien vorangetrieben, die nur auf dem Weltmarkt gekauft werden konnten. Vom wirtschaftspolitischen Standpunkt aus konnte die Autarkie eine Revision des Merkantilismus im Stile des zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts genannt werden. Obwohl sie 쬦erwiegend von kommunistischen und faschistischen Regimes angestrebt wurden, die alle oder zumindest die meisten Aspekte des kapitalistischen Wirtschaftsproduktionsmodells ablehnten, griffen selbst kapitalistische Nationen in Zeiten wirtschaftlicher Instabilit쬦 auf Elemente der Autarkie zur쬦k. Dies war besonders dann der Fall, wenn sie gro쬦 쬦erseereiche kontrollierten und wichtige Rohstoffe aus ihren Kolonien erhielten.
column7: Derivado de la palabra 'autosuficiencia' en griego cl쬦ico, el t쬦mino autarqu쬦 expresaba un objetivo de muchos estados de comienzos del siglo XX, que sent쬦n que una dependencia a쬦 mayor de la econom쬦 era una amenaza para su libertad o para los fundamentos ideol쬦icos de sus reg쬦enes. Para alcanzar la autarqu쬦, estos pa쬦es impon쬦n enormes aranceles a las importaciones ultramarinas, fomentaban el desarrollo de industrias locales para producir bienes hasta entonces importados, regulaban de manera estricta el comercio exterior para preservar los ingresos del pa쬦 e investigaban el desarrollo de alternativas para materias primas cruciales que el pa쬦 no pod쬦 conseguir m쬦 que en el mercado internacional. Como pol쬦ica econ쬦ica, la autarqu쬦 podr쬦 considerarse una revisi쬦 en el siglo XX del mercantilismo, y aunque quienes m쬦 la utilizaron fueron los reg쬦enes comunistas y fascistas que rechazaban el sistema de producci쬦 capitalista en su totalidad o en su conjunto, hasta los pa쬦es capitalistas pod쬦n llegar a recurrir a algunos aspectos de la autarqu쬦 en tiempos de inestabilidad econ쬦ica, sobre todo cuando controlaban grandes imperios transcontinentales que pod쬦n surtirlos de materias primas.

'신용 매수'는 그런 상황에서 최소한의 초기 비용으로 구매 가능한 주식의 수를 늘리기 위해 개발된 방법입니다. 우선 투자자는 증권회사에게서 구매 비용을 빌려 주식을 구매합니다. 이때 구매한 주식은 증권회사가 보관합니다. 투자자는 정해진 기일 내에 이 주식을 매각해 매수시와 매도 때 대금 차액을 정산합니다. 매도 때 주가가 상승했다면, 투자자는 증권회사에서 주가 상승분부터 수수료를 뺀 금액을 이익금으로 받습니다. 반대로의 경우 투자자는 하락분과 수수료를 증권회사에 지불해야 합니다. 그래서 초기 예탁 보증금의 금액을 얼마나 설정하는가 하는 문제는 증권 업계의 경영 상태를 악화시키지 않기 위해 큰 논란이 됐습니다. 금액을 낮게 설정하면 제한된 자본 밖에 가지지 않은 투자자도 시장에 참여가 가능하지만, 이 경우 투자자가 운용에 실패해버리면 채무 불이행에 빠질 위험성이 높아지기 때문입니다.
column3: As more individuals became involved in investing in securities markets in the early twentieth century, the practice of buying on margin developed to increase the amount of shares that could be bought with minimal initial overhead. The principal of buying on margin is that if the investment makes a profit, the profit would cover the cost of the commission charged for allowing the purchase of large amounts of securities with only a minimal initial investment. The risk involved in this type of investment is that if the investment shows a loss, the difference between the initial investment and the commission charged for the purchase must be made up by the investor. How low an initial margin was prudent for the securities industry to accept would be the subject of intense debate, as lower margins both allowed investors with limited capital to invest in markets, but raised the risk of default by these limited-capital investors should the investments fail to produce profits
column4: Comme de plus en plus de personnes participaient 쬦l'investissement sur les march쬦 des valeurs mobili쬦es au d쬦ut du XXe si쬦le, la pratique des achats sur marge fut mis au point pour augmenter la quantit쬦d'actions pouvant 쬦re achet쬦 avec des frais g쬦쬦aux initiaux minimum. Le principal de l'achat sur marge, c'est que si l'investissement rapporte un b쬦쬦ice, le profit doit couvrir le co쬦 de la commission charg쬦 de permettre l'achat de montants important de titres avec un investissement minimal. Quel niveau de marge initiale restait prudent pour le secteur des valeurs mobili쬦es faisait l'objet d'un intense d쬦at, car la baisse des marges a permis aux investisseurs avec un capital limit쬦d'investir sur les march쬦, mais a soulev쬦le risque de d쬦aillance que ces investissements ne produisent pas les b쬦쬦ices attendus.

column2: 1862년 솔페리노 전투의 여파에 대한 잔혹성과 공포를 본 장 앙리 뒤낭은 자비를 털어 '솔페리노의 기억'(A Memory of Solferino)라는 전투의 목격담을 발표했습니다. 그 경험을 바탕으로 부상자 치료에 전념하는 국제 기구를 구상한 그는 1864년 스위스 의회는 제네바에서 전쟁 수행을 위한 국제법을 제정하기 위한 국제회의를 소집했습니다.
column3: Having seen the brutality and horror of the aftermath of the battle of Solferino, Jean Henri Dunant, in 1862, published a witness account of the battle called 'Un Souvenir de Solferino' (A Memory of Solferino), printed at his own expense. Drawing on his experiences, Dunant began formulating ideas about setting up an international organization dedicated to the treating of war wounded, and also toured Switzerland extensively to lecture. Against the backdrop of such ideas, the Swiss parliament, in 1864, called an international convention at Geneva to establish international laws for the conduct of war.

column3: Carl Menger has been hailed as one of the three leaders of the 'Marginalist Revolution' of the 1870s, along with William Stanley Jevons and L쬦n Walras. However, Menger's Grunds쬦ze (Principles), published in 1871, eschewed all the mathematical scaffolding that characterized the works of the other two revolutionaries. As such, many economists have insisted that Menger should be placed apart. In one sense, he can be considered different. His two disciples at Vienna, Eugen von B쬦m-Bawerk and Friedrich von Wieser did much to advance and forge that school.

Toutefois, 'Grunds쬦ze' de Menger (Principes), publi쬦en 1871, renonce 쬦tout l'쬦hafaudage math쬦atique qui caract쬦ise les 쐕vres des deux autres r쬦olutionnaires. In einem Aspekt kann er mit Sicherheit als anders betrachtet werden: Im Gegensatz zu Jevons oder Walras gr쬦dete Carl Menger eine sachgerechte 'Gedankenschule', der 쬦terreichischen Schule, die sich ihren unverwechselbaren Charakter bis heute bewahrt hat. Sin embargo, los Grunds쬦ze (Principios) de Menger, publicados en 1871 evitaron todo el andamiaje matem쬦ico que caracterizaba las obras de los otros dos revolucionarios. column3: Carlism is a traditionalist and legitimist political movement in Spain seeking the establishment of a separate line of the Bourbon family on the Spanish throne. column3: The carronade was a short smoothbore,cast iron cannon, It was used from the 1770s to the 1850s. Its main function was to serve as a powerful, short-range anti-ship and anti-crew weapon. column2: 무탄피탄은 통상적으로 뇌관, 추진제, 발사체를 하나로 묶어두는 탄약통 용기를 제거한 소형 무기 탄약의 일종입니다. 이는 놋쇠나 강철로 만든 용기를 분사해 탄약 무게와 비용을 줄이는 동시에 발사 후 빈 용기를 꺼낼 필요를 없애 반복 총기 운용을 단순화하려는 시도입니다.
column3: Caseless ammunition is a type of small arms ammunition that eliminates the cartridge case that typically holds the primer, propellant, and projectile together as a unit. Caseless ammunition is an attempt to reduce the weight and cost of ammunition by dispensing with the case, which is typically precision made of brass or steel, as well as simplify the operation of repeating firearms by eliminating the need to extract and eject the empty case after firing.

column3: As more radical ideological alternatives to liberal democracy gained power in the early twentieth century, the opportunity to reconstruct economic organization based on State direction of economic activity that could be compared to the relative success or failure of traditional market-based economic structures arose. Such programs of centralized economic planning, employed by both communist and right-wing regimes, often achieved dramatic initial results in reducing unemployment, increasing output of industrial goods, and removing the problem of conflict between laborer and employer in society, which the regimes would trumpet as proof of the superiority of their systems over free market systems. The social and economic costs to these societies, however, were often very high, and the resistance to State control created the potential for brutal repression. However, to the outside world that new little of the negative consequences of these plans, they seemed to suggest a viable alternative to the free-market systems that had been the hallmark of nineteenth century economic theory.
column5: Als Anfang des zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts radikalere ideologische Alternativen zur liberalen Demokratie an die Macht kamen, bot sich die Gelegenheit, die auf der staatlichen Leitung wirtschaftlicher Aktivit쬦en basierende Wirtschaftsorganisation, die mit dem relativen Erfolg oder Scheitern traditioneller Wirtschaftsstrukturen verglichen werden konnte, neu zu strukturieren. Solche zentralisierten Wirtschaftsplanungsprogramme, derer sich sowohl kommunistische als auch faschistische Regimes bedienten, erzielten oft dramatische Anfangserfolge bei der Reduzierung der Arbeitslosigkeit, der Produktionssteigerung von Industrieg쬦ern und der Beseitigung des gesellschaftlichen Konflikts zwischen Arbeitnehmern und Arbeitgebern, was die Regimes dann als 쬦erlegenheit ihrer Systeme den Freihandelssystemen gegen쬦er propagierten. Die sozialen und wirtschaftlichen Kosten dieser Gesellschaften waren oft sehr hoch, und der Widerstand gegen staatliche Kontrolle schuf Potential f쬦 brutale Unterdr쬦kungen. Der Au쬦nwelt, die von den negativen Konsequenzen dieser Pl쬦e nicht viel mitbekam, erschienen sie als funktionsf쬦ige Alternativen zu den Freihandelssystemen, die den Wirtschaftstheorien des neunzehnten Jahrhunderts ihren Stempel aufgedr쬦kt hatten.

Estos programas de planificaci쬦 econ쬦ica centralizada, empleados por los reg쬦enes comunistas y fascistas, alcanzaron muchas veces resultados espectaculares en la reducci쬦 del desempleo y el aumento de la producci쬦 industrial, adem쬦 de acabar con la conflictividad social de car쬦ter econ쬦ico, hecho que ambos sistemas enarbolar쬦n como prueba de su superioridad con respecto a las econom쬦s de mercado. Sin embargo, a menudo los costes sociales y econ쬦icos de estas pol쬦icas fueron muy elevados y la resistencia frente al control del Estado gener쬦las condiciones necesarias para una represi쬦 brutal. Sin embargo, a los ojos del mundo exterior, que apenas sab쬦 nada de las consecuencias negativas de estos planes, eran una alternativa viable a los sistemas econ쬦icos de libre mercado que hab쬦n dominado la teor쬦 econ쬦ica en el siglo XIX.

column3: Charles Spearman was a British psychologist and mathematician. Spearman criticized Galton's tests as being too simple to measure intelligence. He preferred Binet's test, but criticized the use of a universal number to characterize different areas of intelligence. He developed the process of factor analysis, measuring correlations between performance in different test areas. He proposed two underlying factors 'g' for general intelligence to explain the correlations and 's' for specific abilities to explain the imperfections in his correlations. His 'g' factor was not a concrete number, but he too believed in the heritability of intelligence.

column3: In 1707 Neuchatel became a possession of Frederick the Great of Prussia by virtue of his maternal ties to the House of Orange-Nassau, and the principality thus effectively entered a personal union with the Kingdom of Prussia and the Hohenzollern family. column3: In honour of Dr. Engelhardt, original discoverer of the remains, Dr. von Meyer named a new giant saurian as Plateosaurus engelhardti. It seems to be related to Iguanodon and Megalosaurus.
column5: Zu Ehren des Entdeckers Dr. Engelhardt nannte Dr. von Meyer einen neuen riesigen Saurier 'Plateosaurus engelhardti'. Er scheint mit Iguanodon und Megalosaurus verwandt zu sein.

column2: 특이한 파충류를 발견한 라일리 박사와 슈터치베리 박사는 해당 파충류가 현대의 파충류와 달리 턱이 아닌 푹 들어간 구멍에 이빨이 있다고 말합니다.
column3: This unusual saurian has teeth in its sockets instead of having them fused to the jaw like modern reptiles, say Dr. Riley and Dr. Stutchbury, the describers of this lizard.
column5: Dieser ungew쬦nliche Saurier besa쬦Z쬦ne in Zahnh쬦len, nicht wie moderne Reptilien direkt mit dem Kiefer verbundene, wie Dr. Rilez und Dr. Stutchbury, Entdecker der Eidechse, sagen.

column2: 유데스-데슬롱챔프 박사는 척추뼈, 갈비뼈, 팔다리가 발견된 새로운 파충류을 연구합니다. 그는 이 동물이 메갈로사우르스와 관련이 있다고 생각합니다.
column3: Dr. Eudes-Deslongchamps resports on a new saurian known from vertebrae, ribs and limbs. He thinks this animal is related to the Megalosaurus.
column5: Dr. Eudes-Deslongchamps meldet aufgrund von Wirbel-, Rippen- und Gliedma쬦n-Funden einen neuen Saurier. Er glaubt, das Tier ist mit dem Megalosaurus verwandt.

column2: 공룡은 오웬 교수는 메갈로사우르스, 이구아노돈을 포함한 파충류 종들을 묶어 공룡으로 명명했습니다. 이 공룡들의 주목할 점은 거대한 몸집입니다.
column3: Dinosauria is the name Prof. Owen proposed for the tribe of Saurians that include Megalosaurus, Hylaeosaurus and Iguanodon. These dinosaurians are remarkable for their large size.
column5: Prof. Owen schlug f쬦 die Sauriergattung, der Megalosaurus, Hylaeosaurus und Iguanodon angeh쬦en, den Namen Dinosauria vor. Ihre Gr秤e ist bemerkenswert.

column2: 바다에서 새로운 거대 화석이 발견됐습니다. 오웬 교수는 이 화석을 고래 도마뱀을 의미하는 케티오사우르스로 명명했습니다.
column3: A new giant fossil sea-dwelling reptilian was discovered. Prof. Owen named it Cetiosaurus, which means 뱖hale lizard쬦
column5: Neue Entdeckung eines riesigen, aquatischen Reptil-Fossils. Prof. Owen nannte es Cetiosaurus, was 밯al-Echse쬦bedeutet.

column2: 영국 윌트셔에서 하트 모양의 이빨 하나가 발견됐습니다. 분석하신 후에. 그 이빨은 분석한 후 카디오돈으로 명명했습니다
column3: A single heart shaped tooth was discovered in Wiltshire, England. After analyzing it Prof. Owen decided to give it the name of Cardiodon.
column5: Ein einzelner, herzf쬦miger Zahn wurde in Wiltshire, England entdeckt. Prof. Owen entschloss sich nach seiner Analyse, ihn Cardiodon zu taufen.

column2: 만텔 박사는 이구아노돈의 일부 턱이 발견된 후, 이전에 이구아나돈의 턱으로 할당된 턱뼈를 별개의 종으로 분리했습니다.
column3: After some jaws of the Iguanodon were discovered, Dr. Mantell assumed his error in a previously assigned portion of a jaw to this beast and now described it as a separate species.
column5: Nach dem Fund einiger Kieferknochen des Iguanodons vermutete Dr. Mantell einen Fehler in seiner vorherigen Zuordnung eines Kiefers zu diesem Biest und beschreibt ihn nun als separate Spezies.

column2: 생물학자인 리차드 오웬은 남아프리카와 뉴질랜드에서 발견된 멸종된 거대 파충류의 콘크리트 조각품을 실물크기로 만들었습니다. 그는 이 조각품들을 '공룡류'라고 부릅니다.
column3: Biologist Richard Owen creates first life-size concrete sculptures of extinct gigantic reptiles, fossils of which were discovered in South Africa and New Zealand. He calls them 'dinosauria'.
column5: Biologe Richard Owen erstellt erste lebensgro쬦 Skulpturen von ausgestorbenen, gigantischen Reptilien, deren Fossilien in S쬦afrika und Neuseeland entdeckt wurden. Er nennt sie 'Dinosauria'.

column2: 레이디 박사는 미국에서 발견된 두 개의 새로운 공룡을 명명했는데, 트라코돈과 데이노돈입니다. 이름이 붙지 않은 래커티우스와 트로이돈종도 함께 발견됐습니다.
column4: Dr. Leidy beschrieb zwei neue Dinosaurier aus Amerika, namens Trachodon und Deinodon. Weitere untergeordnete Echsen namens Palaeoscincus und Troodon wurden ebenfalls entdeckt.

column2: 이 새로운 공룡은 이구아노돈과 관련이 있는 것으로 보입니다. 레이디 박사는 그 동물이 두 발 뻗은 자세를 유지했을 것으로 의심하고 있습니다.
column3: This new dinosaurian appears to be related to the Iguanodon. Dr. Leidy suspects the animal sustained itself in a bipedal erect posture.
column5: Dieser neue Dinosaurier scheint mit dem Iguanodon verwandt zu sein. Dr. Leidy vermutet bei dem Tier einen aufrechten Gang auf zwei Beinen.

column2: 새로 발견된 공룡류에 세악룡이라는 이름이 붙여졌습니다. 바그너 박사는 해당 생물이 어느 정도 새를 연상시키지만 새와의 관계는 없다고 말합니다.
column3: A new species of saurian was found and was named Compsognathus. Dr. Wagner says the lizard reminds us somewhat of birds but such relationship cannot be justified.
column5: Neue Saurierspezies entdeckt und Compsognathus getauft. Dr. Wagner sagt, die Echse erinnere fern an V쬦el, doch ein solcher Bezug sei nicht erwiesen.

column2: 정교하게 화석화된 깃털이 발견됐고 폰 마이어 박사는 그것을 고대의 깃털이나 날개를 의미하는 Archaopteryx(시조새)로 명명했습니다.
column3: A finely fossilized feather was discovered and Dr. von Meyer named it Archaeopteryx which means ancient feather or wing.
column5: Ein perfektes Fossil einer Feder wurde entdeckt und Dr. Wagner taufte sie Archaeopteryx, was f쬦 eine altert쬦liche Feder oder einen Fl쬦el steht.

column2: 존스턴 박사가 공룡의 치아를 아스트로돈으로 명명한 후, 레이디 박사는 그를 기리는 차원에서 그 공룡에 그의 이름을 붙였습니다.
column3: After Dr. Johnston named some saurian teeth as Astrodon, Dr. Leidy now completes the name and gives it a specific epithet in his honour.
column5: Nachdem Dr. Johnston einige Saurierz쬦ne als Astrodon bezeichnete, vollendet Dr. Leidy nun den Namen zu dessen Ehren mit diesem spezifischen Beinamen.

column2: 코프 교수가 메갈로사우르스와 디노돈과 관련된 무시무시한 거대 공룡의 발견을 발표합니다.
column3: Professor Cope announces the discovery of a terrifying rapacious gigantic dinosaur related to Megalosaurus and Dinodon.
column5: Professor Cope verk쬦det die Entdeckung eines furchterregenden, r쬦berischen, riesigen Dinosauriers, der mit Megalosaurus und Dinodon verwandt ist.

column2: E.D. 코프는 플레시오사우르스와 관련있지만 훨씬 긴 꼬리를 가지고 있는 엘라스모사우르스
column4: E.D. Cope reports on a new enaliosaur related to the Plesiosaurus, but with a much longer tail.
column6: E.D. Cope meldet einen neuen Enaliosaurus, der mit dem Plesiosaurus verwandt ist, aber einen viel l쬦geren Schwanz hat.

column2: 바이에른에서 시조새 화석이 발견됐습니다. '시조새'와 공룡과 새 사이의 '잃어버린 고리'로 묘사되는 이것은 다윈의 진화론을 검증하는 중요한 증거입니다.
column3: Archaeopteryx fossils discovered in Bavaria. Described as 'the first bird' and 'the missing link between dinosaurs and birds', it constitutes the proof Darwin needed to validate his theory.
column5: Archaeopteryx-Fossilien in Bayern gefunden. Die 'ersten V쬦el' bilden 'fehlende Verbindung zwischen Dinosauriern und V쬦eln' und liefern den Beweis, den Darwin f쬦 seine Theorie brauchte.

column2: 마더론 씨는 수룡의 척추뼈와 거대한 난자 조각에 대해 보고했습니다. 그는 이 화석들을 푸보 분지에서 온 히펠로사우르스로 명명했습니다.

column5: Mr. Matheron meldet Funde von Wirbelknochen und gigantischen Eifragmenten eines wom쬦lich aquatischen Sauriers im Fuveau-Becken, den er Hypselosaurus taufte.

column2: 마쉬 박사가 대중에게 코프 박사가 엘라스모사우르스의 머리를 꼬리에 넣는 실수를 저질렀다는 사실을 알린 후, 둘의 맹렬한 경쟁이 시작됐습니다.
column3: After Dr. Marsh reported openly to the public Dr. Cope뭩 error in placing Elasmosaurus쬦head in its tail they have become sworn enemies and a ferocious scientific competition has now started.
column5: Dr. Marshs Ver쬦entlichung, dass Dr. Cope den Kopf des Elasmosaurus irrt쬦lich am Schwanzende anbrachte, machte sie zu Erzrivalen und ein erbitterter wissenschaftl. Wettstreit hat begonnen.

column2: 마쉬 교수와 그의 일행은 사우스다코타의 화이트리버 배드랜드에서 가장 유망한 발굴 현장에 도착하기 위해 수족의 영역을 가로질렀습니다.
column3: In their boldest excursion to date, professor Marsh and his party cross the Sioux territory to reach the most promising excavation sites in the White River Badlands in South Dakota.
column5: Bei der bislang gewagtesten Exkursion dringen Prof. Marsh und sein Team in Gebiet der Sioux vor, um vielversprechende Ausgrabungsorte in den White River Badlands, South Dakota, zu erreichen.

column3: O.C. Marsh and his group are reported to have barely escaped an Indian war party raid against their camp. Their hasty retreat didn't hinder securing of nearly two tonnes of excavated bones.
column5: Laut Meldungen entkamen O.C. Marsh und seine Gruppe nur knapp einem indianischen Raubzug gegen ihr Lager. Trotz 쬦ereilter Flucht konnten fast 2 Tonnen ausgegrabener Knochen gesichert werden.

column2: 코프 교수는 애착을 가졌던 지질 조사 탐험대를 떠나 수십 종의 새로운 척추동물을 발견했다고 산후안강 지역에서 보도했습니다.
column3: Professor Cope reports from the San Juan River area, where he discovered dozens of new vertebrate species after departing from the geological survey expedition he had been attached to.
column5: Prof. Cope berichtet nach seiner R쬦kkehr von der geologischen Expedition, an der er teilgenommen hatte, von der Entdeckung dutzender, neuer Wirbeltierarten in der Gegend des San Juan-Flusses.

column2: O.C. 마쉬는 와이오밍주 코모 블러프의 발굴 현장에서 발견한 두껍고 통나무만큼 긴 뼈들을 공개합니다. 디플로도쿠스와 알로사우루스는 새로 발견된 많은 종들 중 하나입니다.

column5: O.C. Marsh meldet die Ausgrabung von Knochen, so dick und lang wie Baumst쬦me, durch zwei Mitarbeiter in Como Bluff, Wyoming. Neben Diplodocus und Allosaurus auch viele neue Arten.

column2: 시조새의 새로운 화석은 발톱과 이빨과 같은 파충류의 놀라운 특징을 보여줍니다. 진화론자들은 이 발견들을 크게 만들어 놓았고 그것을 잃어버린 연결고리라고 부르고 있습니다.
column3: New fossils of the primitive bird Archaeopteryx show shocking reptilian features as claws and teeth. Evolutionists are making a big deal of these findings and call it a missing link.
column5: Neue Fossilien des primitiven Vogels Archaeopteryx zeigen schockierende Reptilienmerkmale wie Klauen und Z쬦ne. Evolutionisten rei쬦n sich um die Entdeckung, sie sei ein fehlender Link.

column2: 헉슬리 교수가 또 다른 터무니없는 진화론을 제기한 후 많은 저명한 고생물학자들은 그의 정신 상태를 두려워합니다. 그는 파충류 공룡과 새들이 관련이 있다고 말합니다!
column3: Many prominent palaeontologists are fearing for Prof. Huxley뭩 mental state after he proposed another ridiculous evolutionary claim: he says reptilian dinosaurians and birds are related!
column5: Viele bekannte Pal쬦ntologen f쬦chten um Prof. Huxleys Geisteszustand, nachdem er eine weitere l쬦herliche Evolutionstheorie vortrug: er sagt, reptilische Dinosaurier und V쬦el sind verwandt!

column2: 새로운 종류의 이상하고 거대한 거북이가 북아메리카 서부에서 발견됐습니다. 마쉬 교수는 그것을 지붕이 있는 도마뱀을 뜻하는 스테고사우루스라고 불렀습니다.
column3: A new kind of weird and enormous turtle was discovered in the North American West. Prof. Marsh called it Stegosaurus, meaning roofed lizard.
column5: Eine neue Art einer merkw쬦digen, gigantischen Schildkr쬦e wurde im Westen Nordamerikas entdeckt. Prof. Marsh nennt sie Stegosaurus, was soviel wie 쬦erdachte Eidechse heisst.

column2: O.C. 마쉬의 획기적인 발견입니다. 다른 익룡류와는 달리 북아메리카에서 발견된 공기로 운반되는 생물들의 화석은 완전히 이빨이 부족했던 것 같습니다.

column5: Bahnbrechende Entdeckung von O.C. Marsh. In Nordamerika gefundene Fossilien von fliegenden Kreaturen hatten, im Gegensatz zu anderen Pterosaurus-Arten, keine Z쬦ne.

column3: Buried in a coal formation in Wyoming lied 'the wreck of one of the princes among giants', as E.D. Cope described of what was undoubtedly the largest land animal known to date.
column5: Laut E.D. Cope liegt in einer Kohleformation in Wyoming 'das Wrack eines Prinzen unter den Giganten', zweifelsohne das bislang gr秤te, entdeckte Landtier.

column2: 마쉬, 코프, 그리고 레이디는 발굴 작업을 와이오밍의 브리저 분지 지역으로 옮깁니다. 그들의 기지는 불과 수마일 떨어져 있고, 상위 3명의 고생물학자들은 서로 대화를 안하는 것으로 보고되고 있습니다.
column3: Marsh, Cope and Leidy move their excavation work to the Bridger Basin area in Wyoming. Their camps mere miles apart, top three paleontologists are reported to never speak with one another.
column5: Marsh, Cope und Leidy verlagern Ausgrabungsarbeiten nach Bridger Basin, Wyoming. Trotz benachbarter Lager wechseln die drei f쬦renden Pal쬦ntologen kein Wort miteinander.

column2: 마쉬 교수는 명문 국립과학원에 당선된 것에 대해 기뻐하고 있습니다. 한편 코프 교수가 유일하게 '불합격' 투표를 한 것으로 알려졌습니다.
column3: Professor Marsh is elated over his election to the prestigious National Academy of Sciences. Professor Cope is reported to have been the only member of the academy to cast a 'no' vote.
column5: Professor Marsh erfreut 쬦er seine Wahl in anerkannte Nationale Akademie der Wissenschaften. Laut Meldungen votierte Professor Cope als einziges Akademiemitglied mit 'Nein'.

column2: 마쉬 교수가 키가 크고 거의 날개가 없는 수생 생물인 황혼조를 발견했다고 발표합니다. 황혼조는 강력한 뒷다리로 추진하며 이빨이 있는 부리로 수중 먹이를 낚아했을 것으로 예측됩니다.
column3: Professor Marsh announces discovery of Hesperornis, a tall and almost wingless aquatic volucrine propelling with powerful hind legs and using his toothed beak to snatch underwater prey.

column3: Dug up and assembled by palaeontologist O.C. Marsh, to the untrained eye, Brontosaurus looks suspiciously similar to the already known Apatosaurus. His skull is completely different, though.
column5: Der von Pal쬦ntologe O.C. Marsh ausgegrabene und zusammengesetzte Brontosaurus sieht dem bekannten Apatosaurus verd쬦htig 쬦nlich. Der Sch쬦el ist jedoch komplett anders.

column2: 마쉬 교수가 뿔 달린 공룡을 새로 발견했습니다. 이 동물은 공룡의 다양성이 예상보다 더 크다는 것을 보여줍니다.
column3: A new kind of horned dinosaur was discovered by Prof. Marsh. This animal shows that the diversity of these great saurians is bigger than suspected.
column5: Neue Art geh쬦nter Dinosaurier von Prof. Marsh entdeckt. Das Tier beweist, dass die Artenvielfalt dieser riesigen Saurier gr秤er ist als angenommen.

column2: 마쉬 교수가 발표하기를 이 커다란 육식공룡은 큰 이빨을 가진 두개골이 악몽에서나 볼법하게 끔찍하게 생겼다고 합니다.

column2: 마쉬 교수가 발표하기를 케라토사우루스의 발견으로 인해 새와 공룡의 관계가 더욱 밀접해졌다고 말합니다.
column3: The discovery of ankylosed (fused) metatarsal bones of a dinosaur called Ceratosaurus brings birds and dinosaurs closer together, O.C. Marsh says.
column5: Die Entdeckung ankylosierter (verschmolzener) Mittelfu쬦nochen eines Dinosauriers namens Ceratosaurus bringt V쬦el und Dinosaurier, laut O.C. Marsh, n쬦er zusammen.

column2: 코프 교수가 새 공룡을 발견하고 뼈의 특징에서 착안해 코엘로피시스로 명명했습니다.

column3: Edward C. Tolman was another prominent American psychologist in the field of Behaviorism. Tolman performed maze experiments to demonstrate latent learning in animals. He showed that a rat could run the maze on the first try, if it was previously allowed to explore the maze while not hungry. Tolman evinced that the subject learned useful stimulus information about the world without reference to a reinforcing stimulus (the food). The ability to run the maze correctly on trial one demonstrated flexibility in the use of the learned information. Tolman's stimulus-stimulus (S-S) learning was opposed by the stimulus-response (S-R) orthodoxy of Skinner.

column3: Eduard Bernstein was originally a staunch disciple of Marx and started his life in the German Socialdemocratic Party, but during his later exile in London Bernstein gradually became convinced that the best way to obtain socialism in an industrialized country was through trade union activity and parliamentary politics. He published a series of articles where he argued that the predictions made by Karl Marx about the development of capitalism had not come true. He pointed out that the real wages of workers had risen and the polarization of classes between an oppressed proletariat and capitalists, had not materialized. Nor had capital become concentrated in fewer hands. Bernstein's revisionist views appeared in his extremely influential book Evolutionary Socialism (1899).

column3: Originally sent as an internal memo of King Wilhelm I of Prussia to the Prussian Chancellor Otto von Bismarck, concerning demands made by the French Ambassador during an informal meeting between him and the Monarch at the Spa resort Bad Ems in Prussian Hesse-Nassau, the Ems dispatch was perhaps the most important triggering factor that led to France's declaration of what would later be known as the Franco-Prussian war. column3: The idea of Woman's Suffrage increasingly gained traction in Western society throughout the 19th century. First advocated in the writings of early liberal philosophers, such as England's Mary Woolstonecraft or John Stuart Mill, the idea and ideology of Woman's Suffrage gradually developed, as the century wore on, into a coherent ideology in its own right: Feminism. The experience during The First World War, of women working in factories, and other jobs previously reserved for men during peacetime, is often said to have been a crucial pivot point in securing Woman's right to work, vote, and, in other fields of society, achieve legal equality with men.

Die Erfahrungen des ersten Weltkriegs, als Frauen in Fabriken und anderen Berufen die Rollen der M쬦ner einnahmen, werden oft als Wendepunkt f쬦 das Recht der Frauen auf Arbeit, Wahlrecht, Gleichberechtigung und andere gesellschaftliche Aspekte bezeichnet.

Primero defendido en los escritos de los primeros fil쬦ofos liberales, como la inglesa Mary Woolstonecraft o John Stuart Mill, la idea e ideolog쬦 del Sufragismo se desarroll쬦gradualmente, a medida que el siglo transcurr쬦, hasta convertirse en una ideolog쬦 coherente por derecho propio: el feminismo. While opponents argue that prohibition threatens to turn the alcohol market into a lucrative business for organized crime, the Temperance League, on the contrary, argues that alcohol is in fact the root cause of many social ills, not least of which is, indeed, crime.

Aunque sus adversarios aseguran que la prohibici쬦 podr쬦 convertir el mercado del alcohol en un lucrativo negocio para el crimen organizado, la Liga por la Templanza, a su vez, replica que el alcohol es la fuente de muchos males sociales, de los cuales no es el menor, ni de lejos, el crimen.

column2: 무함마드 알리는 알바니아 출신으로, 19세기 초 이집트 오스만군의 카발라 지원병으로 복무했습니다. 이집트에서 나폴레옹이 철군하자, 오랜 정치적 책략을 통해 맘루크 세력을 숙청하고 이집트의 총독으로 임명됐습니다. 그의 통치 기간 동안 이집트에서는 일련의 서구화 개혁이 시행됐습니다. 이러한 개혁에 대한 저항은 한동안 이집트의 발전을 막겠지만, 장기적으로는 더 낫습니다.
column3: Muhammad Ali, an Albanian born in Macedonia during Ottoman rule there, served in the Kavala Volunteer Contingent of the Ottoman Army in Egypt during the first years of the 19th century. Following the withdrawal of Napoleon's armies from Egypt Muhammad, through a long series of political maneuvering, came to be elected Wali (governor) of Ottoman Egypt, a position he would eventually use to secure Egypt as his own personal domain as Mamluk power waned. During his reign he instituted a series of more or less popular, and more or less successful, reforms, all aiming to transform Egypt into a modern, European-style, state. Resistance to these reforms will slow down technological progress for a time, but the benefit to Egypt itself will be immeasurable.

column2: 재건은 남북전쟁 이후 구 남부연합 주들을 연방에 재통합하는 것을 목표로 해 제정된 정책, 법률, 법령, 헌법 개정, 대통령령을 설명하는 집합 용어입니다. 이 정책들은 주로 '노예주'의 결말, 남부민족주의의 억압, 남부 주들에 의한 13차 수정헌법 인정과 같은 문제들에 초점을 맞췄습니다. 재건은 1877년의 타협으로 마침내 연방군이 남부에서 철수하면서 끝났습니다. 남부군 현수막은 사바나와 리치먼드의 잿더미 속에 짓밟혀 있고 이제 재건을 시작할 때입니다.
column3: Reconstruction is the collective term used to described the policies, laws, decrees, constitutional amendments and presidential orders enacted, after the American Civil War, with the goal of reintegrating the former Confederate states back into the Union. The policies centered chiefly around issues like the ending of 'Slave Power', the suppression of Southern nationalism and revanchism, and the recognition of the 13th amendment by the Southern states. Reconstruction ended with the compromise 1877, when federal troops where finally withdrawn from the South. The Confederate banners lie trampled in the ashes of Savannah and Richmond, and it's time to start the reconstruction.

column2: 1862년 에이브러햄 링컨 대통령이 서명한 자영 농지법은 신청 조건을 충족한 신청자에게 160에이커의 땅을 무상으로 제공하는 법률이었습니다. 이 법 외에도 유사한 내용을 규정한 연방법이 몇개 존재했습니다. 이 법은 미국에게 누구나 성공할 수 있는 기회의 땅이라는 인상을 안겨준 요인 중 하나입니다.

end_of_confederation_BOL_desc;볼리비아는 더 이상 페루와 연결되어 있지 않으며 연방 해체를 선언할 수 있습니다.;As Bolivia is not connected to Peru anymore, the Confederacy can be declared extinct.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

end_of_czechoslovakia_bohemia_desc;보헤미아와 슬로바키아의 연방은 해체됐습니다. 이제 체코슬로바키아에 종지부를 찍을 때입니다.;The union of Bohemia and Slovakia has been sundered. It is time to bring Czechoslovakia to an end.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x,
end_of_czechoslovakia_bohemia_title;체코슬로바키아 해체;The End of Czechoslovakia;;;;;;;;;;;;;x,
end_of_czechoslovakia_slovakia_desc;보헤미아와 슬로바키아의 연방은 해체됐습니다. 이제 체코슬로바키아에 종지부를 찍을 때입니다.;The union of Bohemia and Slovakia has been sundered. It is time to bring Czechoslovakia to an end.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x,
end_of_czechoslovakia_slovakia_title;체코슬로바키아 해체;The End of Czechoslovakia;;;;;;;;;;;;;x,
end_of_hungarian_revolution_desc;혁명을 계속해 나갈 희망은 없습니다. 혁명가들은 패배했고 우리나라는 점령당했습니다.;There is no hope for us to continue. Our revolutionaries stand defeated and our country occupied-- we must submit!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x,
end_of_hungarian_revolution_title;헝가리 혁명 종료;End of the Hungarian Revolution;;;;;;;;;;;;;x,
end_of_iberia_portugal_desc;이베리아 연합은 더이상 존재하지 않습니다. 허상의 이베리아는 제쳐주고, 진실된 포르투갈로 회귀해야 합니다.;The Iberian union is no longer the truth. We must put aside the fiction and become Portugal in truth.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x,
end_of_iberia_portugal_title;포르투갈 결성;Become Portugal;;;;;;;;;;;;;x,
end_of_iberia_spain_desc;이베리아 연합은 더이상 존재하지 않습니다. 허상의 이베리아는 제쳐주고, 진실된 에스파냐로 회귀해야 합니다.;The Iberian union is no longer the truth. We must put aside the fiction and become Spain in truth.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x,

end_of_pound_sterling;파운드화 기축통화 지위 상실;End of Pound Sterling as world currency;;;;;;;x
end_of_the_UK_desc;스코틀랜드와 아일랜드가 모두 탈퇴해버렸기 때문에, 이 왕국은 더 이상 '연합'왕국이 아닙니다. 잉글랜드 만세!;With both Scotland and Ireland gone, this Kingdom can't be called 'United' anymore. Long live England!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
end_of_the_UK_title;연합왕국 해체;The end of the United Kingdom;;;;;;;;;;;;;x,

end_the_merina_monarchy_desc;1897년 지역 봉기가 일어나자 오랫동안 마다가스카르를 세력권에 가두어 두었던 프랑스는 정식으로 왕실을 폐위하고 섬을 합병했습니다.;Following a local uprising in 1897 France, who had long held Madagascar in its sphere of influence, formally deposed the Royal House and annexed the Island.;Apr쬦 une r쬦olte qui eut lieu en 1897, la France qui avait longtemps tenu Madagascar dans sa sph쬦e d뭝nfluence, a formellement d쬦os쬦la famille royale et annex쬦l믬le.;Nach einem lokalen Aufstand im Jahr 1897 l쬦te Frankreich, das Madagaskar lange in seiner Einflusssph쬦e gehalten hatte, das K쬦igshaus offiziell auf und annektierte die Insel.;;Tras un levantamiento en 1897, Francia, que hac쬦 tiempo que ten쬦 a Madagascar en su esfera de influencia, depuso a la casa real y se anexion쬦oficialmente la isla.;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
end_the_merina_monarchy_title;메리나 왕국의 멸망;End The Merina Monarchy;Fin de la monarchie Merina;Ende der Merina-Monarchie;;El fin de la dinast쬦 Merina;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
end_the_war;종전;End the War;La Guerre Doit Finir;Der Krieg Muss Beenden;;;;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
end_the_war_desc;적은 패배했습니다. 국민들은 의도한 모든 것을 얻지는 못하더라도 전쟁을 끝내라고 외칩니다.;Our enemy is defeated. The people call out for us to end the war, even if we don't get everything we intended.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x,,;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
end_xeu_ambition_desc;유럽 이웃들과 -정치적 연합이 아닌- 자유무역연합을 맺은 우리나라는 유럽연합의 가장 큰 수출 시장입니다. 그들은 일자리를 얻기 위해 우리에게 의존합니다. 그 반대가 아닙니다.;Free trade, but not political union, with our European neighbours. We are the EU largest export market: they depend on us for jobs - not the other way around.;;;;;;;x
end_xeu_ambition_title;유럽 회의론;Euroscepticism;;;;;;;x
enemy_plotting_cards;적선 식별도;Enemy Plotting Cards;Fiches d'identification de l'ennemi;Feindschiffskarten;;Planos dise쬦 enemigo;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
enemy_plotting_cards_desc;이 도표는 적국의 함대 종류별 최대 성능과 함영도(함대의 그림자 도표)를 기재한 것입니다. 덕분에 함대 지휘관이나 함장은 앞으로 싸울 적함의 최대 속도나 무장의 정도 등 다양한 성능을 쉽게 습득해 교전이나 철수 같은 판단을 내릴 때 활용합니다.;These cards held the full performance and picture of each enemy ship class. This made it easier to know what one was fighting, what its maximum speed was, its main armament etc. This made it much easier to make decisions both on the bridge and out on the combat stations.;Ces fiches d쬦enaient toutes les caract쬦istiques et l'image de la classe de chaque navire ennemie. C'쬦ait une facilit쬦de savoir contre quoi on se battait, sa vitesse maximale, son armement principal, etc. Cela rendait beaucoup plus facile de prendre des d쬦isions 쬦la fois sur le pont et dans les postes de combat.;Diese bebilderten Karten zeigten s쬦tliche Leistungsdaten aller feindlichen Schiffsklassen. So konnte man einfach ermitteln, welchen Gegner man vor sich hatte, was seine Maximalgeschwindigkeit und Hauptbewaffnung war usw. Dies erleichterte die Entscheidungsfindung auf der Br쬦ke und auf den Kampfstationen ungemein.;;Estas cartas conten쬦n im쬦enes y caracter쬦ticas de cada tipo de nave enemiga. Esto hizo m쬦 sencillo saber contra qu쬦se luchaba, qu쬦velocidad m쬦ima ten쬦, cu쬦 era su armamento principal, etc. Facilit쬦enormemente la toma de decisiones, tanto en el puente como en los puestos de combate.;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

establish_la_guardia_civil_desc;'라 과르디아 시빌', 우리말로 '민방위대'는 이사벨라 2세 여왕 치세 때 자유주의자들이 카를리스타 전쟁에서 승리한 후 시골에 남아있던 카를리스타 정서를 억제하려 창설한 헌병 군단입니다. 이 군단은 경찰과 군대 간의 혼합체로 연방 차원에서 운영되고 있으며, 현대에도 존속합니다.;La Guardia Civil', Spanish for 'The Civil Guard', is the Spanish gendarmerie corps, established during the reign of Queen Isabella II to suppress lingering Carlist sentiments in the countryside after the Liberal victory in the Carlist wars. The corps is a blend between a police and a military force, operating on a federal level, and has remained in existence through to modern time.;La Guardia Civil, ou la garde civile espagnole, est un corps de gendarmerie form쬦sous le r쬦ne de la reine Isabelle II pour 쬦ouffer les sentiments carlistes apparus dans le pays apr쬦 que les lib쬦aux remport쬦ent les guerres carlistes. Ce corps combinant forces polici쬦es et militaires op쬦ant au niveau f쬦쬦al a perdur쬦jusqu'쬦nos jours.;La Guardia Civil', Spanisch f쬦 'Die B쬦gerwehr', ist das spanische Gendarmenkorps, das w쬦rend der Regentschaft von K쬦igin Isabelle II. zur Unterdr쬦kung des nach dem Sieg der Liberalen in den Karlistenkriegen auf dem Land anhalten Sympathie mit dem Karlismus aufgestellt wurde. Das Korps ist eine Mischung aus Polizei- und Milit쬦truppe und operiert auf Bundesebene. Es existiert heute noch.;;La 'Guardia Civil' es un cuerpo de gendarmer쬦 espa쬦l que fue fundado por la reina Isabel II para suprimir los persistentes sentimientos afines a los Carlistas en el campo tras la victoria liberal en las Guerras Carlistas. El cuerpo es una mezcla de fuerza policial y militar que opera a nivel federal. Su existencia se mantiene hasta el d쬦 de hoy.;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

establish_the_dar_al_funun_desc;다르알푸눈은 페르시아에 세워진 최초의 현대적 대학기관입니다. 1851년 당시 카바르 왕조의 나스레딘 샤의 고관이었던 아미르 카비르가 창시한 이 기관은 페르시아의 상류층 청년들을 의학, 자연과학, 군사기술을 교육합니다. 어서 젊은이들에게 현대 세계를 맛보게해야 합니다!;The Dar al-Funun was the first modern university type institution established in Persia. It was founded in 1851 by Amir Kabir, then vizier to Nasreddin Shah of the Qajar dynasty, and was a modern polytechnic dedicated to educating Persia's upper class youth in the arts of medicine, natural science and military technology. Let us give our youth a taste of the modern world by establishing this fine institution!;Le Dar al-Funun fut la premi쬦e institution universitaire moderne 쬦ablie en Perse. Il fut fond쬦 en 1851, par Amir Kabir, ensuite vizir de Nasreddin Shah de la dynastie Qajar, et 쬦ait une 쬦ole polytechnique moderne destin쬦 쬦accueillir les jeunes des classes sup쬦ieures perses dans les domaines de la m쬦ecine, des sciences naturelles et de la technologie militaire. Offrons 쬦nos jeunes un go쬦 du monde moderne en 쬦ablissant cette remarquable institution !;Die Dar al-Funun war die erste moderne Hochschule Persiens. Sie wurde im Jahr 1851 von Amir Kabir gegr쬦det, dem damaligen Wesir des Kadscharen-K쬦igs Naser ad-Din Schah, und war ein modernes Polytechnikum zur Ausbildung der Jugend der persischen Oberklasse in Medizin, Naturwissenschaften und Milit쬦technologie. Lasst uns der Jugend durch die Gr쬦dung dieser gro쬦rtigen Einrichtung eine Vorstellung von der modernen Welt geben!;;La Dar al-Funun fue la primera instituci쬦 de ense쬦nza universitaria que se cre쬦en Persia. Fue fundada en 1851 por Amir Kabir, el entonces visir del shah Nasreddin de la dinast쬦 Qajar, como un instituto polit쬦nico moderno dedicado a educar a la juventud de clase alta de Persia en las artes de la medicina, las ciencias naturales y la tecnolog쬦 militar. 좪nse쬦mos a nuestra juventud las maravillas del mundo moderno a trav쬦 de la fundaci쬦 de esta esplendida instituci쬦!;;;;;;;;;x;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

establish_the_sovnarkom_desc;'소비에트 나로드니크 코미사로프', 우리말로 '인민대표회의'는 1918년 러시아 소비에트 연방 사회주의 공화국 헌법이 명시한 가장 높은 정부 부처입니다. 소비에트 인민위원회는 (공식적으로) 소비에트 연방의회에 대한 책임이 있었고 의회가 해산됐을 때, 그 권한(입법권)을 행사할 수 있습니다.;Soviet Narodnykh Kommissarov', transliterated Russian for 'Council of People's Commissars', was the highest government authority in Soviet Russia, per functions delineated in the 1918 Constitution of the RSFSR. The Sovnarkom was (formally) responsible to the Congress of The Soviets and had, when said Congress was out of session, the power to issue decrees carrying the full force of law.;Le Soviet Narodnykh Kommissarov" qui signifie litt쬦alement le "Conseil des commissaires du peuple" fut la plus haute autorit쬦gouvernementale de la Russie sovi쬦ique dont les fonctions furent d쬦inies dans la constitution de 1918 de la R쬦ublique socialiste f쬦쬦ative sovi쬦ique de Russie (RSFSR). Le Sovnarkom 쬦ait officiellement responsable devant le Congr쬦 des Soviets de l'administration g쬦쬦ale des affaires de l'쬦at.
column5: Soviet Narodnykh Kommissarov', Russisch f쬦 'Rat der Volkskommissare', war die h쬦hste Regierungsbeh쬦de der Sowjetunion und wurde in der Verfassung der RSFSR von 1918 verankert. Die Sovnarkom war (formell) f쬦 den sowjetischen Volkskongress verantwortlich und hatte, wenn besagter Kongress nicht tagte, die Macht zur Erlassung von Dekreten mit voller gesetzlicher Macht.
column7: El 'Soviet Narodnykh Kommissarov', que en ruso significa 'Consejo de Comisarios del Pueblo' era la mayor autoridad de gobierno de la Rusia Sovi쬦ica, cuyas funciones se delineaban en la constituci쬦 de 1918 de la RSFS. El Sovnarkom era responsable (de manera formal) del Congreso de los Diputados del Pueblo y ten쬦, cuando dicho congreso no estaba en sesi쬦, capacidad para emitir decretos con plena validez legal.

column2: 에티오피아와 이집트 사이의 긴장 관계는 끝나야 합니다. 우리는 각자 각자의 땅이 있고, 정말로 우리가 싸울 이유도 없습니다. 최악의 경우, 지속되는 분쟁이 두 나라 모두를 외국 강대국들의 착취에 취약하게 만들 것입니다.
column3: The strained relations between Ethiopia and Egypt must come to an end. We each have our respective lands, and truly there is no reason for us to fight. At worst, continued conflict will leave both our nations weak to exploitation by foreign powers.

column2: 학자로서의 뵘바베르크의 최대 활동은 '자본과 이자'의 세 권 중 두 권을 처음으로 출판한 인스부르크 대학교(1881-1889)에서 활동할 때입니다. 그의 말년은 오스트리아 재무장관으로의 시간이 길었습니다. 1904년, 그는 다시 교직에 복귀했으며, 그가 있던 10년 동안 이 대학을 졸업한 학생 중에는 조셉 슐페터와 루드비히 폰 미제스도 있었습니다.
column3: Bohm-Bawerk's career as a scholar was an intermittent one. The most significant span of scholarly activity was his years at the University of Innsbruck (1881-1889). It was during the 1880s that he first published two of the three volumes of his magnum opus, Capital and Interest. His later years were dominated by his duties as the Austrian Minister of Finance, a position he held, though not continuously, throughout the 1890s and beyond-and for which he is fittingly honored by having his likeness on Austria's one-hundred schilling note. After serving in this capacity and assuming other governmental duties, he returned to teaching in 1904. With a chair at the University of Vienna, he became a colleague of Wieser, successor to the retired Menger. Students who passed through the university during the last decade of B쬦m-Bawerk's career (and life: he died in 1914) included Joseph Schumpeter and Ludwig von Mises.

column2: 자연선택과 특성론 등의 진화론적 개념 지능측정 연구결과를 조합해 탄생한 우생학은 사회에서 발견되는 정신적/육체적 약자들을 염려했습니다. 긍정적인 우생학은 가족계획, 사회복지, 그리고 번식의 만족도에서 교육의 중요성을 장려했습니다. 부정적인 우생학자들은 바람직하지 않은 요소를 제거함으로써 약한 특성을 제거해야 한다고 주장했고, 이는 특정 집단의 절멸과 몰살로 이어졌습니다.
column3: An outgrowth from Darwinistic ideas on natural selection and trait theories and from the studies in intelligence measurement, Eugenics was concerned with the mental and physical traits found in society and a response to the weaknesses found. Positive eugenics encouraged family programs, social welfare, and the importance of education in the desirability of breeding to increase the appearance of positive traits. Negative eugenics argued for the need to remove weak traits by removing undesirable elements, leading to sterilization and even extermination of target groups.

column2: 농지 집중 농사로 인해 지력이 소진됐습니다. 지력을 회복할 때까지 생산량이 감소합니다.
column3: The intensive farming of this province's farmland has exhausted the soil. Production will be low until the land recovers.

column2: 시간이 지남에 따라 국가의 이상을 개선할 필요성도 높아집니다. 이 새로운 전시 방식은 주변의 다른 나라들에게 그들보다 앞서 번영하고 있음을 보여주기 위해서입니다. 세계의 다른 나라들은 이러한 변화에 기뻐하고 있습니다.
column3: As time presses on, so does the need to improve upon the ideals of the country. This new style of exhibition puts us above other countries around us, to show that we are progressing to a greater era of prosperity for our nation. Most countries in the rest of the world are pleased with this change of events.

column2: '시간은 아무도 기다려주지 않는다'는 말은 국가들에도 적용됩니다. 새로운 견해들이 우리나라에서 들불처럼 퍼져나가고 있습니다. 많은 사람들은 이러한 변화를 세계에 보여주기 위해 일어날 것입니다. 이로 인해 다른 나라에서의 국제적 위신이 향상됐습니다.
column3: The saying that 'Time waits for noone' holds true for nations as well. New ideas are spreading through your country like wildfire, many wish to hold a exhhibition to show the world these changes. This has improved your nation's image with the other countries.

column2: 새로운 견해들이 전국적으로 다시 넘쳐나고 있으며, 지식인들은 전시회를 위해 돈을 기부하라고 설득했습니다. 주변 국가들이 우리나라의 근황을 확인하려 몰려들었기 때문에 그만한 가치가 있었습니다.
column3: New ideas are abound in the nation again, moreover the intellectuals of the nation has convinced us to 'donate' some money towards another exhibition. It was worth it in the end, as nations around flocked to see what our nation has been doing lately.

column2: 지식인들이 우리나라의 주머니 속으로 들어갑니다. 또 다른 전시회가 소집됐고, 더 나아가서는 세계 각국에 우리나라의 문화발전을 보여주었습니다.
column3: Into the pockets of our great nations the intellectuals descend into. For another exhibition has been called, and furthermore has shown the nations of the world that we are in the up and coming in terms of cultural development.

column2: 이번 전시회의 기획자들은 전 세계를 강타한 최신 '유행'에 대한 내용이 될 것이라고 장담했습니다. 국민들도 이에 공감하고 있습니다. 다른 나라들은 우리를 더 나은 시각으로 바라봅니다. 그래서 결국 그럴만한 가치가 있었죠. 그렇죠쬦
column3: The organizers of this latest exhibition have assured us that it will be about the latest 'fad' that has struck the world. A lot of our nation's people agree with this as well. Well, other nations look at us in a better light, so it was worth it in the end. Right쬦

column2: 세계 각국에 우리나라의 지위가 올라갔음을 보여줄 수 있는 기회입니다. 당신의 보살핌 아래 우리나라가 계속 번창하기를 바랍니다.
column3: This is a chance to show the nations of the world our great state, as such our status has risen in the eyes of many. May the nation continue to prosper under your care.

column2: 라시드 가문을 꺾었으니, 그들을 추방해야 합니다. 이번 추방으로 아라비아를 우리의 깃발 아래 하나로 뭉쳐야 합니다.
column3: We are victorious over the House of Rashid. We must send them into exile, so that Arabia stands united under a single flag: our own.

column2: 사우드 가문을 꺾었으니, 그들을 추방해야 합니다. 이번 추방으로 아라비아를 우리의 깃발 아래 하나로 뭉쳐야 합니다.
column3: We are victorious over the House of Saud. We must send them into exile, so that Arabia stands united under a single flag: our own.

column2: 실존주의는 철학적 운동이 아닌 단점이 있다고 간주됐던 이질적인 철학적 분석, 논의의 개념입니다. 직관, 시간, 지성 그리고 실존과 사물에 대한 일반적인 개념을 잘못된 문제를 낳지 않도록 재편해야 합니다.
column3: Existentialism has many mothers. In one way it could be interpreted as a radical individualism traced from Kierkegaard and Nietzsche, but it is more. But it also the notion of the given as not really given but only meaningful through the process of interpretation something that it got from Husserl and more indirectly from Bretano. However it was take further by Heidegger and later Sartre, Beauvoir, and Camus, and became focused on what give meaning to the person, where the person should be understood more like a being that is free to make action and thus create her own meaning than the old cartesian self.
column5: Der Existenzialismus war das geistige Kind Vieler. Auf eine Art konnte er als radikaler Individualismus interpretiert werden, wof쬦 Kierkegaard und Nietzsche standen, aber der Existenzialismus war mehr als das: Er stand auch daf쬦, dass das Gegebene nicht wirklich gegeben war, sondern nur durch den Prozess der Interpretation Bedeutung erlangte. Diesen Aspekt steuerten Husserl und indirekt Bretano bei. Von Heidegger und sp쬦er Sartre, Beauvoir und Camus wurde der Existenzialismus weiter vorangebracht und fokussierte sich zunehmend auf die Frage, was das Gegebene f쬦 die Person bedeutet, wobei die Person mehr als ein Wesen verstanden werden sollte, das seine Handlungen frei entscheiden und so gem癌 dem alten kartesischen Selbst seine eigene Bedeutung erzeugen kann.
column7: El existencialismo tiene muchas madres. En un sentido podr쬦 interpretarse como un individualismo radical que se remonta hasta Kierkegaard y Nietzsche, pero es algo m쬦. Tambi쬦 es el concepto de don no como dado realmente, sino que s쬦o significa algo a trav쬦 del proceso de interpretaci쬦, algo que ven쬦 desde Husserl y m쬦 indirectamente desde Brentano. column3: During The War of The Triple Alliance, when Paraguayan troops invaded the Brazilian province of Mato Grosso, Pedro II, the Brazilian Emperor, angered by what he saw as incompetence on part of the Brazilian military, demanded that he himself be allowed to go in person to the front. column3: Sir Francis Galton was a British aristocrat who wrote extensively on the measurement of an individual's mental abilities using sensory and motor tests. His 1869 work 'Hereditary Genius:  An Inquiry into its Laws and Consequences' argued that the children of geniuses tended to become geniuses themselves. He surveyed thousands of fellow academics, publishing in 1874 his findings that intelligence was primarily a heritable trait, although there was some necessity for environmental nurturance of that trait. He was the first to use identical and fraternal twins to measure the effects of nature versus nurture, and established in 1888 the theoretical basis for correlation, scatterplots, and regression as measurement tools.

column2: 지그문트 프로이트는 정신분석학의 기초를 세운 오스트리아의 신경학자입니다. 그는 무의식적인 마음과 억압의 회로에 대한 이론으로 가장 잘 알려져 있고, 환자와 정신분석가 사이의 대화를 통해 마음을 조사하고 정신병리학을 치료하기 위한 심리분석의 임상적인 방법을 창조하는 것으로 가장 잘 알려져 있습니다. 프로이트는 성적인 욕구를 인간 삶의 주된 동기로 보았고, 자유로운 연계의 사용과 같은 치료 기술을 개발했으며, 치료 관계에서 과도현상을 발견했고, 분석 과정에서 그것의 중심적인 역할을 확립했습니다.
column3: Sigmund Freud was an Austrian neurologist who founded the disciple of psychoanalysis. He is best known for his theories on the unconscious mind and the mechanism of repression, and for creating the clinical method of psychoanalysis for investigating the mind and treating psychpathology through dialogue between a patient and a psychoanalyst. Freud established sexual drives as the primary motivational forces of human life, developed therapeutic techniques such as the use of free association, discovered the phenomenon of transference in the therapeutic relationship and established its central role in the analytic process.

column2: 프리드리히 엥겔스는 청년이 되자 아버지가 경영하던 목화 농장을 떠나 맨체스터로 일감을 찾아 떠났습니다.  그 곳에서 도시에 만연한 빈곤에 충격을 받은 그는 후에 '영국에서의 노동자 계급의 상태(1844년)'를 발표합니다. 이윽고 마르크스와 만나 서로 힘을 합쳐 남은 일생을 바쳐 집필 활동과 국제적 노동자 조직을 결성하기 위한 활동에 전력합니다. 엥겔스의 공적은 지적인 측면에서는 마르크스에 미치지 못했지만, 경제적인 면에서 마르크스가 집필 활동에 전념하게끔 자금을 지원했습니다.  마르크스는 엥겔스 없이는 위대한 사상가가 될 수 없었을 것이고, 또 그 반대로도 마찬가지입니다.
column3: As a young man Engels went to Manchester to help his father manage his cotton-factory. Engels was shocked by the poverty in the city and began writing an account that was published as Condition of the Working Classes in England (1844). Here Engels met Marx with whom he would write and try to organize the international worker organizations for the rest of his life. Engels lived in the shadows of Marx' intellectually, but economically he financed Marx so that he could write. Basically there wouldn't have been a Marx without an Engels and vice versa.
column4: Jeune homme Engels est all쬦쬦Manchester pour aider son p쬦e 쬦g쬦er son usine de coton. column5: Als junger Mann ging Engels nach Manchester, um seinem Vater bei der Leitung seiner Baumwollfabrik zu helfen. Engels war von der Armut der Stadt schockiert und schrieb als Konsequenz die Abhandlung 'Die Lage der arbeitenden Klasse in England' (1844). column2: 프리드리히 하이에크는 1930년대 국가적 정책에 대해 케인즈 학파의 영향력이 커진 것에 의문을 제기함과 동시에 각국에서 주목하던 공산주의, 파쇼주의이라는 두 정치 체제가 모두 같은 뿌리인 계획경제체제를 지향한다고 지적한 오스트리아의 경제학자입니다. 그의 스승인 루트비히 폰 미제스와 마찬가지로 하이에크도 케인즈 학파 경제학의 경기대책 방안을 수요 창출이 공급력 추종보다 빠르기 때문에 인플레이션을 발생시킬 수 있으므로 문제해결보다는 잠재적 문제의 확대의 원인을 비난했습니다. 또한 하이에크는 소비자 수요에 따라 상품의 공급량이나 품질을 조절하는 기능이 매우 낮다는 점에서 계획경제의 개념을 부인했습니다.
column3: An Austrian economist who would challenge the influence of Keynesian economics upon the actions of the State in the 1930s and attach the planned economic models inherent in both socialist and right-wing political models increasingly in vogue in the era. Much like his teacher Ludwig von Mises, Hayek attacked Keynesian economic prescriptions for dealing with economic downturns as causing more potential problems than solutions by creating conditions for inflation by raising demand more rapidly than supply could meet. Hayek rejected the idea of central planning in the marketplace as highly inefficient in its ability to produce the supply and quality of goods that would be generated by consumer demand
column5: Hayed war ein 쬦terreichischer 쬦onom, der den wachsenden Einfluss der keynesianischen Wirtschaftskonzepts auf die Handlungen des Staats w쬦rend der 1930er Jahre kritisierte. Dar쬦er hinaus wandte er sich gegen die sozialistischen und faschistischen Planwirtschaftsmodelle, die zu jener Zeit immer popul쬦er wurden. Ganz wie sein Lehrer Ludwig von Mises griff Hayek das keynesianische Konzept zur Korrektur wirtschaftlicher Schieflagen als L쬦ung an, die eher zus쬦zliche Probleme kreierte als bestehende l쬦te, indem sie durch die rasante Steigerung der Nachfrage, mit der das Angebot nicht mithalten konnte, inflation쬦e Bedingungen schuf. column3: Friedrich List was a nationalist and romantic critic of economic theory and one of the forefathers of the German Historical School. His best-known work, The National System of Political Economy (1841) was written as against the free-trade doctrines that permeated Classical economics. However, his was not a polemical defense of protectionism. He argued it on the basis of his analysis of economics, which stressed political factors - notably, the 'nation' - in economics. List argued that it was the government's responsibility to foster the 'productive powers' of a nation and, once these were in place, then free trade could ensue, but not before. This is akin to the modern 'infant industry' argument for protection. More relevantly, he developed a theory of economic 'stages' which was to serve as a blueprint for the German Historical School.

Toutefois, son syst쬦e n'쬦ait pas un moyen de d쬦ense pol쬦ique du protectionnisme. Sein Werk war aber keine polemische Verteidigung des Protektionismus. Vielmehr argumentierte er auf der Grundlage seiner Wirtschaftsanalyse, die sich mit den politischen Faktoren in der Wirtschaft, vor allem der Nation, befassten. List war der Ansicht, dass es in der Verantwortung einer Regierung l쬦e, die produktiven Kr쬦te einer Nation aufzubauen und dass Freihandelsbedingungen erst nach Abschluss dieses Vorgangs gelten sollten. column3: As the questioning of the values and structures of the Victorian era gained momentum in intellectual circles in the early twentieth century, some intellectuals began to argue that a clean break with the past was needed in order to build a brilliant new future that the rise of industrial civilization had promised. column5: Als die Hinterfragung der Werte und Strukturen der viktorianischen Zeit Anfang des zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts in intellektuellen Kreisen Eigendynamik entwickelte, brachten einige Intellektuelle vor, zur Schaffung einer gl쬦zenden Zukunft, den der Aufstieg der industrialisierten Zivilisation versprach, sei ein klarer Schnitt mit der Vergangenheit notwendig. column2: 그랜빌 스탠리 홀은 미국 심리학 협회의 초대 회장입니다. 홀은 1887년에 미국 심리학 저널을 설립했습니다. 그의 연구는 교육적 심리와 청소년기에 초점을 맞췄습니다. 그는 청소년기의 특징을 나타내기 위해 'S&S{폭풍(Storm)과 스트레스(Stress)}'라는 용어를 사용했습니다. 홀은 행동의 귀속을 믿었고 우생학 프로그램을 지지했습니다. 그러나 그의 견해는 이후 피아제나 비고츠키에 의해 크게 반박됐습니다.
column3: G. Stanley Hall was the first President of the American Psychological Association. Hall founded the American Journal of Psychology in 1887. His research focused on educational psychology and adolescence. He adapted the term 'Storm and Stress' to characterize the period of adolescence. Hall believed in the heritability of behavior and supported the Eugenics program. His views on child development were later largely refuted by Piaget and Vygotsky.

column2: 신고전주의 경제학에 대해 쉬몰러와 칼 멩거 간에 '방법논쟁'으로 유명한 일련의 논란이 있었습니다.  대부분의 사람들은 '슈몰러'가 논쟁을 일방적으로 중단하겠다는 취지의 통보를 했으므로 그가 논쟁에 졌다고 여깁니다(멩거의 연구 논문을 받은 슈몰러가 그것을 읽지도 않고 되돌려보내고 "읽을가치가 없었다"라는 내용의 '반논평'을 발표함). 하지만 그럼에도 불구하고 독일 대학임명제도에 단단한 지배력을 유지하며 주로 고전파와 신고전파 경제 이론을 독일 경제학회에서 축출했습니다. 이것은 당시는 잠재적인 도전자에 불과했던 멩거를 오스트리아 학파가 철천지 원수로 간주하게 된 원인이 됐습니다. 그의 업적으로는 정치 분야에 대한 참여도 중요합니다. 1872년 그는 국가-산업-노동자의 협조를 지지하고 주로 보수파 경제학자가 중심이 된 사회정책학회를 설립했습니다. 자유주의자들은 그들이 언급하는 국가의 경제간섭원래를 우려해 쉬몰러와 제자의 역사학파를 '강단사회주의자'라고 야유했습니다.
column3: Schmoller's opposition to Neoclassical economics entered him into a famous methodological debate (Methodenstreit) with Carl Menger. Although many argue that he lost the debate by the simple fact of non-engagement (it is reported that upon receiving Menger's Investigations, he returned it unread to its author and published a 'semi-review' of it claiming that, indeed, it had not even been worth reading), Schmoller nonetheless retained his grip on the German university appointment system and kept Classical and Neoclassical economic theory largely out of German teaching - earning him the eternal enmity of the only potential challenger at the time, Menger's Austrian School. Gustav Schmoller's political involvements were also important, in 1872, he formed the Verein f쬦 Sozialpolitik, ('Society for Social Policy'), a group of largely conservative economists which supported a kind of corporatist state-industry-labor nexus. Liberals deplored their advocacy for state interventionism and came to label Schmoller and the Historicists as Kathedersozialisten (or 'Socialists of the Chair') - a jest they never entirely lived down.
column4: L'opposition, de von Schmoller 쬦l'쬦onomie n쬦classique, a conclu un c쬦쬦re d쬦at m쬦hodologique (Methodenstreit) avec Carl Menger. Bien que beaucoup affirment qu'il a perdu le d쬦at par le simple fait de sa non-participation (il est indiqu쬦쬦la r쬦eption des enqu쬦es de Menger, qu'elles sont retourn쬦s sans 쬦re lues 쬦son auteur), Schmoller n쬦nmoins a conserv쬦son emprise sur le syst쬦e de nomination 쬦l'universit쬦allemande et a gard쬦la th쬦rie 쬦onomique classique et n쬦classique en grande partie hors de l'enseignement allemand  ce qui lui a valu l'inimiti쬦쬦ernelle du seul rival potentiel de l'쬦oque, l'쬦ole autrichienne de Menger. Les engagements politiques de Gustav von Schmoller ont 쬦alement 쬦쬦importantes, en 1872, il a form쬦le Verein f쬦 Sozialpolitik, (soci쬦쬦pour la politique sociale), un large groupe d'쬦onomistes conservateurs qui ont soutenu une sorte de corporatiste dans un lien 쬦at-industrie et travailleur. Les lib쬦aux d쬦loraient ce plaidoyer en faveur de l'interventionnisme 쬦atique et ont brocard쬦Schmoller et les historicistes de Kathedersozialisten (ou socialistes de la chaire) - une plaisanterie tr쬦 basse.
column5: Schmollers Kritik an den neoklassischen Wirtschaftsans쬦zen f쬦rte zu seinem ber쬦mten Methodenstreit mit Carl Menger. Obwohl die meisten der Ansicht sind, dass er die Debatte schlicht durch die Verweigerung jeglicher Diskussion verlor (es ist 쬦erliefert, dass er Mengers Untersuchungen kommentarlos zur쬦kgeschickt und eine Art von Halbkritik ver쬦fentlicht hatte, in der er Mengers Arbeit als nicht des Lesens wert bezeichnete), 쬦derte dies nichts an seinem Einfluss auf das Berufungssystem an deutschen Universit쬦en. Schmoller konnte klassische und neoklassische Wirtschaftstheorien gr秤tenteils von der deutschen Wirtschaftslehre fernhalten - was ihm ewigen Ruhm als dem damals einzigen potentiellen Herausforderer von Mengers 쬦terreichischer Schule einbrachte. Gustav Schmoller verf쬦te auch 쬦er wichtige politische Verbindungen. Im Jahr 1872 gr쬦dete er den 'Verein f쬦 Socialpolitik', einer gr秤tenteils aus konservativen Wirtschaftswissenschaftlern bestehende Gruppe, die eine Art Verkn쬦fung von korporativistischem Staat und Industriearbeit unterst쬦zte. Liberale beklagten ihre Bef쬦wortung des staatlichen Interventionismus und nannten Schmoller und die Historiokraten Kathedersozialisten (oder Stuhlsozialisten) - eine sp쬦tische Bezeichnung, die sie nie v쬦lig vergessen machen konnten.
column7: La oposici쬦 de Schmoller a la econom쬦 neocl쬦ica le introdujo en un famoso debate metodol쬦ico (Methodenstreit) con Carl Menger. Aunque muchos argumentaban que perdi쬦dicho debate por el simple hecho de no enzarzarse en el mismo(es sabido que tras recibir las investigaciones de Menger se las devolvi쬦sin leerlas y public쬦una 'semi-cr쬦ica' de las mismas declarando que, de hecho, ni siquiera merec쬦n leerse), Schmoller conserv쬦su control sobre el sistema de nombramientos de la universidad alemana y mantuvo la teor쬦 econ쬦ica cl쬦ica y neocl쬦ica apartada de las ense쬦nzas alemanas, gan쬦dose la eterna enemistad de la 쬦ica rival potencial del momento, la escuela austriaca de Menger. La participaci쬦 de Gustav Schmoller en pol쬦ica fue importante: en 1872 fund쬦la Verein f쬦 Sozialpolitik (Sociedad para la pol쬦ica social), un grupo de economistas enormemente conservadores que apoyaban una especie de nexo corporativista estado-industria-trabajo. Los liberales deploraban su defensa del intervencionismo del estado y llegaron a etiquetar a Schmoller y a los historicistas de Kathedersozialisten (socialistas de sill쬦), una broma que nunca se olvid쬦del todo.

column2: 하티 후마윤, 즉 '제국개혁칙령'은 오스만주의, 즉 제국의 종교집단 간의 평등이 자국의 사회적 문제를 해결할 것이라는 믿음을 논리적인 결론으로 가져갈 것입니다. 모든 권리가 제국의 소수민족에게 부여될 것이며, 각 밀레트에 자국 주민의 종교법을 사용할 권리를 부여하는 법이 통과됐습니다. 이는 오스만이 겪은 민족주의 분쟁의 일부를 다루는 데 큰 도움이 될 것이고 오스만 제국을 새롭고 다문화적인 시대로 이끌 것입니다.
column3: The Hatt-i Humayun, or 'Imperial Reform Edict', will take the concept of Ottomanism-- the belief that equality among the Empire's religious groups will solve its social issues-- to the logical conclusion. Full rights will be granted to the Empire's minorities, and laws passed to grant each millet the right to use  the religious law of its population. This will go a long way towards dealing with some of the nationalist strife the country has suffered, and bring the Ottoman Empire into a new and multicultural age.

column2: 하티 후마윤, 즉 '제국개혁칙령'은 제국에 대한 이슬람의 지배를 확고히 할 것입니다. 그것은 아나톨리아와 남부 영토 안에서 평화를 공고히 하는 데 큰 도움이 될 것이며, 아마도 제국이 전통을 등지고 있는 다른 대국들과 같은 불화와 불확실성을 겪지 않도록 보장해 줄 것입니다.
column3: The Hatt-i Humayun, or 'Imperial Reform Edict', will cement the Islamic rule over the Empire. It will go a long way towards cementing peace within Anatolia and our southern lands, and perhaps ensure that the Empire does not suffer the same discord and uncertainty that other great nations have who turn their back on tradition.

column2: 오스만 계획은 1852-1870년 사이에 수행된 파리의 현대화 계획으로, 파리의 오래된 중심가가 성장하는 도시의 기반시설 요구를 충족할 수 없음이 증명되면서 시작됐습니다. 오스만이 이때 기획한 길게 뻗은 대로는 그 이후로 파리의 거리 배치의 특징을 규정해왔습니다.
column3: The Haussmann Plan was a project for the modernization and urban renewal of Paris, carried out between 1852 and 1870. The project was initiated after a period of rapid urban growth and development, as the old city center of Paris had proven itself incapable of meeting the infrastructure demands of a growing city. The long, open boulevards championed by Hausmann have remained defining characteristics of Paris' street layout ever since.
column4: Le plan Haussmann est un projet pour la modernisation et le renouveau urbain de Paris, qui fut mis en place de 1852 쬦1870. column3: Hussar refers to a number of types of light cavalry which originated in Hungary during the 15th century. column3: For many nations, the socioeconomic strains caused by involvement in wars with other industrial nations resulted in huge deficits that made it impossible to return immediately to the gold standard. Some nations, facing new demands upon their incomes as a result of new social obligations to those involved in recent wars or obligations for being on the losing side of wars, found the demands too great, and sought to resolve their problems by expanding the amount of currency of circulation. With nothing to guarantee the value of the currency, the result would be to rapidly depreciate the value of the currency relative to other currencies or materials such as gold. The social impact of such government policies were traumatic, especially for those who lived on limited or fixed incomes or those who had investments denominated in the rapidly depreciating currency. To many, the willingness of the State to engage in such activity, and the market reaction to such activities, would lead to a search for alternative ideologies to restore order and stability in society

column3: A theory of production management developed by Frederick William Taylor in 1911 that asserted that worker productivity could be maximized by optimizing different tasks to those workers who are best able to perform those tasks. column3: the growth of the global economy in the nineteenth and early twentieth century resulted in increased demand for industrial goods by non-Western societies. However, the realities of war in the industrial age and increasing economic instability of periods of expansion and contraction resulted in non-Western societies at times being unable to meet their needs for industrial goods from the traditional producers of such goods in the West. As a result, an opening for producers in non-Western societies to meet the demand for those industrial goods that could not be acquired easily from the West arose, and industrialization in the non-Western world began to grow. Eventually pressure to protect these new industries from competition from overseas would lead some nations which had maintained political independence to adopt policies of import substitution industrialization to encourage their societies to break their dependence upon the West for industrial goods and, by extension, strengthen their own societies in the global economic system. Import substitution industrialization would gain in influence during the course of the twentieth century as the resources of the West were dedicated more towards resolving problems in the West.

column3: Irving Fisher was one of the earliest American Neoclassicals of unusual mathematical sophistication. He made numerous important contributions to the Neoclassical Marginalist Revolution. This Yale economist was an eccentric and colorful figure. When Irving Fisher wrote his 1892 dissertation, he constructed a remarkable machine equipped with pumps, wheels, levers and pipes in order to illustrate his price theory. Socially, he was an avid advocate of eugenics and health food diets. He made a fortune with his visible index card system - known today as the rolodex - and advocated the establishment of an 100 percent reserve requirement banking system. His fortune was lost and his reputation was severely marred by the 1929 Wall Street Crash, when just days before the crash, he was reassuring investors that stock prices were not overinflated but, rather, had achieved a new, permanent plateau.

column3: Ivan Pavlov was a Russian physiologist and winner of the Nobel Prize for his work on reflexes in digestion. In the course of studies with dogs and salivation, Pavlov observed that the dogs elicited a certain type of salivation with certain signals that preceeded the arrival of food. In his 1927 study, Pavlov laid out the basic principles of classical conditioning in Behaviorism. The food was the unconditioned stimulus for salivation. The signal became associated with salivation as a conditioned stimulus, with salivation to the sound of the signal alone becoming the new conditioned response. Extinction, recovery, generalization and discrimination were identified in subsequent studies.

column2: 제임스 밀은 제러미 벤담의 공적의 그늘에 가려져 있지만, 그 역시 중요한 급진적 사상가였습니다. 두 사람 모두 공리주의의 창시자라고 여겨집니다. 공리주의의 일반적인 적용에 관한 대부분은 밀의 저서 속에서 설명하고 있습니다. 그의 주요 저서에는 '경제학 요강(1821년)'이나 '인간 정신 현상의 분석(1829년)'등이 있습니다.

column2: 전통적인 아프리카 음악적 요소를 서양 음악의 기술 및 이론과 결합시켜 탄생한 '재즈'는 20세기 초 미국 남부 뉴올리언스의 한 나이트 클럽에서 세련미를 더해갔습니다. 서양과 아프리카 문화의 절묘한 융합으로 태어난 열정적이고 환상적인 리듬과 힘찬 멜로디, 연주자가 각각의 느낌으로 즉흥적으로 올리는 매혹적인 가수의 노랫소리가 합쳐진 재즈는 순식간에 세계적으로 유행을 맞았습니다. 그리고 이 유행에는 당시 발명된지 얼마 안된 다양한 신기술(예를 들면 전축기, 라디오, 유성영화)가 큰 도움이 됐습니다. 많은 전통문화인들은 재즈의 유행을 전통적 권위에 대한 새로운 반역의 하나로 간주하고 난색을 표했습니다. 그러나 1920년대에 재즈는 전 세계 대중 음악의 1위 장르로서 확고한 지위를 구축했습니다.
column3: Originating in the fusion of Western musical tradition with elements of traditional African music, Jazz evolved out of the nightclubs of New Orleans in the southern United States in the early twentieth century. Its blend of frenetic, intoxicating rhythms, powerful melodies which encouraged improvisation by performers to add their own distinctive touches to each performance, and energetic vocals would hit upon the world just as new technologies to spread new music, such as the phonograph record, radio and sound cinema, provided a platform to showcase it to a worldwide audience. In the 1920s it became one of the dominant forms of popular music in the world, though many of the traditional arbiters of taste frowned upon its popularity as further proof that society was rebelling against proper authority
column5: Jazz hatte seine Wurzeln in der Fusion westlicher Musiktraditionen mit Elementen afrikanischer Musik und entstand Anfang des zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts in den Nachtclubs von New Orleans im S쬦en der USA. Diese Mischung aus wilden, berauschenden Rhythmen und kraftvollen Melodien, die die Musiker zu Improvisationen anregte, um jeder Vorstellung Besonderheit zu geben, und schwungvollem Gesang eroberte die Welt, als gerade neue Distributionstechnologien f쬦 Musik wie Grammophon-Schallplatten, Radio und Kino aufkamen, um sie einem weltweiten Publikum zu pr쬦entieren. In den 1920er Jahren war Jazz eine der popul쬦sten Musikrichtungen, obwohl viele Kritiker seine Popularit쬦 missbilligten, und diesen als weiteren Beweis daf쬦 sahen, dass die Gesellschaft gegen die Obrigkeit rebellierte.

column2: 존 브로더스 왓슨은 인간에 대한 조건 반사 훈련을 연구한 미국 심리학자입니다. 왓슨의 가장 유명한 실험은 알버트라고 불리는 11살 아이에게 조건부 자극을 학습시킨 실험이었습니다. 왓슨의 연구는 후에 사람들의 비이성적인 두려움을 없애주는 임상 치료로 이어졌습니다. 대학원생과의 불륜과 결혼으로 하버드에서 해고된 후, 왓슨은 그의 연구 경험을 유명한 광고 회사에 가져왔습니다. 현대 광고는 행동주의적인 심리학과 조건화 개념의 덕을 많이 보았습니다.
column3: John Broadus Watson was an American psychologist who studied Pavlovian conditioning in humans. Watson's most famous experiment involved conditioning an 11-year old child named Albert to associate a conditioned stimulus (fear of rats) to an unconditioned stimulus (fear of a loud hammering sound). Watson's research later led to clinical treatments extinguishing irrational fears in people. After being dismissed from Harvard over an affair and marriage with a graduate student, Watson brought his research experience to a prominent advertising firm. Modern advertising owed much to behaviorist psychology and conditioning concepts.

column3: Jean-Baptiste Say was a French scholar active in the field of political economy. A contemporary of Adam Smith, he also advocated economic competition and freedom of trade. He wrote the Trait쬦d'쬦onomie politique ou simple exposition de la mani쬦e dont se forment, se distribuent et se composent les richesses, originally published in 1803. column2: 요한 하인리히 폰 튀넨은 메클렌부르크 지역의 지주였습니다. 그는 첫 번째 논문 '고립된 나라'(1826년)에서 임대 이론과 연계해 공간경제학의 진지한 치료법을 내놓았습니다. 그의 두 번째 논문(1850년)은 수학적으로 정확한 분포의 한계생산성 이론의 정수를 발전시켜 당대의 유명인 중 한 사람이 됐습니다. 그는 죽을 무렵 노동의 한계 산물 즉, 자연스러운 임금을 위한 자신의 유명한 공식을 자신의 묘비에 새길 것을 요청했습니다.
column3: Johann Heinrich von Th쬦en was a North German landowner from the Mecklenburg area. Although educated at G쬦tingen, he spent most of his life managing his rural estate, Tellow. column3: John Elliot Cairnes was a follower of John Stuart Mill. His Slave Power (1862), a defense of the North in the American Civil War, made a great impression in England. He has written about noncompeting groups in the labor market and is known for his distrust of mathematical economics. Among his works are The Character and Logical Method of Political Economy (1857) and Some Leading Principles of Political Economy Newly Expounded (1874).

Sein Werk "The Slave Power, its Character, Career and probable Designs" (1862), eine Verteidigung der Nordstaaten im amerikanischen B쬦gerkrieg, machte in England gro쬦n Eindruck.
