column2: 존 메이너드 케인즈는 사회에 존재하는 다양한 경제 세력의 관리에 대한 국가의 역할과 경제 위기 때 수료량과 공급량과의 관계에 대해 당시의 전통적인 견해에 의문을 제기한 영국의 경제학자입니다. 공업 대국들의 세계대전이 한창일 때 케인즈는 국가가 자국의 경제동원력을 활용해 효과적인 경제 발전을 촉진할 수 있다고 주장했습니다. 그러나 케인즈 이론에서 가장 혁신적이었던 점은 경제의 총수요의 역할을 중시한 것에 있었습니다. 그는 "공급은 수요를 낳는다"라고 생각하고 있던 기존의 통설을 비판하고 생산력과 경제 성장에 따른 생산량 수준의 최종 결정 요소는 공급이 아니라 수요라고 주장했습니다. 그 위에 경기 후퇴, 경제 위기 때는 그 해결책으로서 공급 과잉을 흡수함과 동시에 향후 수요의 증가에 알맞은 생산 능력을 확보하기 위해 수요를 의도적으로 창출할 것을 주장했습니다. 기존의 통설을 뒤엎는 그의 이론은 발표 당시 많은 비판을 받았지만 시간이 지나면서 매우 큰 영향력을 갖게 됐습니다.
column3: An English economist who challenged the orthodox view of the role of the State in the management of economic forces in society and the relationship between supply and demand in times of economic crisis. Drawing upon the abilities of states to mobilize their economies during wars with other industrial nations, Keynes maintained that the State could use its influence to promote more efficient economic development. But his most radical theory involved the role of aggregate demand in the economy, arguing that it was demand, not supply, that was the final determinant in the levels of output and growth that an economy could produce, and that in times of economic slowdown or crisis, the solution to the crisis involved revival of demand to absorb excess supply and create the conditions for a revival of production to meet further increases in demand. While his theories had many critics, they became highly influential as the twentieth century progressed
column5: Keynes war ein englischer 쬦onom, der die orthodoxe Meinung 쬦er die Rolle des Staats als Verwalter der gesellschaftlichen Wirtschaftskr쬦te und die Beziehung von Angebot und Nachfrage in Zeiten der Wirtschaftskrise herausforderte. Keynes st쬦zte sich auf die F쬦igkeiten von Staaten, ihre Wirtschaftssysteme w쬦rend Kriegen mit anderen Industrienationen zu mobilisieren und blieb bei seiner Ansicht, der Staat k쬦ne seinen Einfluss zur F쬦derung einer effizienteren Wirtschaftsentwicklung nutzen. Seine radikalste Theorie jedoch drehte sich um die Rolle der gesamtwirtschaftlichen Nachfrage: Keynes argumentierte, dass die Nachfrage und nicht das Angebot die ausschlaggebende Determinante f쬦 die Leistung und das Wachstum der Wirtschaft sei, und dass in Zeiten wirtschaftlichen R쬦kgangs oder w쬦rend Krisen die L쬦ung in der Nachfragesteigerung l쬦e, um 쬦ersch쬦siges Angebot zu absorbieren und die Bedingungen zur Wiederbelebung der Produktion zur S쬦tigung weiterer Nachfragesteigerungen zu schaffen. Obwohl viele seine Theorien kritisierten, wurden sie im Verlauf des zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts 쬦쬦rst einflussreich.
column7: Un economista ingl쬦 que cuestion쬦la visi쬦 ortodoxa del papel del estado en la gesti쬦 de las fuerzas econ쬦icas en la sociedad y la relaci쬦 entre la oferta y la demanda en tiempos de crisis econ쬦icas. Bas쬦dose en la capacidad de los estados para movilizar sus econom쬦s en tiempos de guerra con otros pa쬦es industrializados, Keynes lleg쬦a la conclusi쬦 de que el estado pod쬦 utilizar su influencia para fomentar de manera eficaz el desarrollo econ쬦ico. Pero su teor쬦 m쬦 radical fue la del papel de la demanda agregada en la econom쬦, que sosten쬦 que es la demanda, y no la oferta, la que determina los niveles de producci쬦 y crecimiento de una econom쬦 y que en tiempos de ralentizaci쬦 econ쬦ica o crisis la soluci쬦 pasa por absorber el exceso de oferta y crear las condiciones para un aumento de la producci쬦 capaz de hacer frente a aumentos de la demanda. Aunque sus teor쬦s recibieron muchas cr쬦icas, fueron haci쬦dose cada vez m쬦 influyentes a medida que avanzaba el siglo XX.

column2: 많은 저서를 남긴 스코틀랜드인 저널리스트 존 램지 매컬럭은 고전적 리카도학파 중에서도 가장 열렬한 광신도였습니다.  매컬럭은 처음엔 'The Scotsman' 편집자였습니다. 그 후 휘그당계의 '에든버러 리뷰' 신문으로 이적해 1830년대 후반까지 경제부 편집자로 근무했습니다. 당시 매컬럭은 고전 이론을 전파하고, 곡물법 폐지, 구빈법 유지, 노동조합의 합법화라는 자신이 지지하는 경제 정책을 추진하기 위해 리뷰지에서 자신의 위치를 이용했습니다. 또 매컬럭은 1828년부터 1832년까지 런던 대학에서 정치 경제학 강의를 담당했으며, 1838년에는 여왕 서조선의 회계 감사관에 임명됐습니다. 매컬럭의 주요 저서로 '원리(1825년)'는 아마 사상 최초의 '충실한' 경제학 교과서라 할 수 있습니다. (하지만 그 내용은 리카도 이론의 충실한 설명이었습니다.) 그러나 매컬럭은 종종 경제 이론의 발전에 관해서는 '경량급', 즉 별로 공헌하지 않았다고 생각되고 있습니다. 그런 그의 주된 공헌이라고 하는 것이 불운한 '임금 기금설(1824년, 1825년, 1826년)'입니다.  매컬럭은 애덤 스미스의 1828년판 '국부론', 데이비드 리카도의 1846년판 책의 편집자이기도 했습니다. 게다가 경제 사상사의 초기 논문의 편집(리카도학파에게 유리하도록)도 다루었습니다. 1837년에 쓰인 그의 기념비적 논문은 맬서스 학파의 인구론에 관한 실패를 통계에 근거해 나타낸 것입니다.
column3: A prolific Scottish journalist, John Ramsay McCulloch was one of the most ardent and doctrinaire expositors of the Classical Ricardian School. McCulloch began his career as the editor of The Scotsman, eventually moving on to the whiggish Edinburgh Review, where he served as economics editor until the late 1830s. McCulloch used his position at the Review to popularize the Classical theories and promote his favorite economic policies, such as the repeal of the Corn Laws, the retention of the Poor Laws and the legalization of trade unions. McCulloch also lectured on political economy at University College London from 1828 to 1832. In 1838, he was appointed the Comptroller of HM Stationary Office. McCulloch's main work, Principles (1825), was perhaps the first successful 'serious' textbook in economics (and a rather loyal reading of Ricardo's theory). However, McCulloch is often considered a 'lightweight' in terms of the development of economic theory. His main contribution was the ill-fated 'wages fund' doctrine (1824, 1825, 1826). McCulloch was also the editor of the 1828 edition of Adam Smith's Wealth of Nations and the 1846 edition of David Ricardo's Works. He also composed some of the earliest accounts of the history of economic thought (naturally, flattering to the Ricardians).  His monumental 1837 treatise provides a statistical account of the failure of the Malthusian population doctrine.
column4: Un prolifique journaliste 쬦ossais, John Ramsay McCulloch est l'un des commentateurs les plus ardents et doctrinaires de l'쬦ole classique ricardienne. McCulloch a commenc쬦sa carri쬦e comme r쬦acteur en chef de The Scotsman, avant de passer 쬦la whig revue d'Edimbourg, o쬦il a 쬦쬦r쬦acteur 쬦onomique jusqu'쬦la fin des ann쬦s 1830. McCulloch s'est servi de sa position 쬦la revue pour populariser les th쬦ries classiques et promouvoir ses politiques favorites 쬦onomiques, telles que l'abrogation des Corn Laws, le maintien de la loi sur les pauvres et la l쬦alisation des syndicats. McCulloch a 쬦alement donn쬦des conf쬦ences sur l'쬦onomie politique 쬦l'University College de Londres de 1828 쬦1832. En 1838, il a 쬦쬦nomm쬦contr쬦eur des HM Stationary Office. Le principal travail de McCulloch, Principes (1825), 쬦ait peut-쬦re le premier succ쬦 s쬦ieux en terme de manuel d'쬦onomie (et une lecture assez fid쬦e de la th쬦rie de Ricardo). Toutefois, McCulloch est souvent consid쬦쬦 comme "l쬦er" en termes de d쬦eloppement de la th쬦rie 쬦onomique. Sa principale contribution a 쬦쬦la doctrine de l'infortun쬦쳀onds des salaires쬦(1824, 1825, 1826). McCulloch 쬦ait 쬦alement le r쬦acteur en chef de l'쬦ition 1828 du patrimoine d'Adam Smith des Nations Unies et de l'쬦ition 1846 de Travaux David Ricardo. Il a 쬦alement compos쬦quelques-uns des premiers r쬦its de l'histoire de la pens쬦 쬦onomique (naturellement, flatteur pour les ricardiens). Son monumental trait쬦de 1837 pr쬦ente un compte rendu statistique de l'쬦hec de la doctrine malthusienne de la population.
column5: John Ramsay McCulloch war ein erfolgreicher schottischer Journalist und einer der gl쬦endsten und doktrin쬦sten Verfechter der klassischen ricardischen Schule. McCulloch begann seine Karriere als Herausgeber von 'The Scotsman' und arbeitete schlie쬦ich bis in die sp쬦en 1830iger Jahre als Redakteur des Wirtschaftsteils des Whig-Blattes 'Edinburgh Review'. Dort setzte McCulloch seine Position zur Bekanntmachung der klassischen Theorien und zur F쬦derung der von ihm favorisierten Wirtschaftsstrategien ein. Dazu geh쬦ten die Aufhebung der Getreidezollgesetze, die Beibehaltung des Armenrechts und die Legalisierung von Gewerkschaften. Dar쬦er hinaus unterrichtete McCulloch von 1828 bis 1832 am University College London Volkswirtschaftslehre. 1838 wurde er zum Kontrolleur des HM Stationary Office ernannt. McCullochs Hauptwerk, 'Principles' (1825) war vermutlich das erste erfolgreiche, ernstzunehmende Wirtschaftslehrbuch - eine der ricardischen Theorie gegen쬦er relativ loyale Abhandlung. Hinsichtlich der Eintwicklung volkswirtschaftlicher Theorien wird McCulloch dennoch oft als eher unbedeutend angesehen. Sei wichtigster Beitrag war die unter keinem guten Stern stehende 'Wages Fund'-Doktrin (1824, 1825, 1826). McCulloch war au쬦rdem Herausgeber der 1828er Ausgabe von Adam Smiths 'Wealth of Nations' und der 1846er Ausgabe von David Ricardos Werken. Dar쬦er hinaus stellte er eine der ersten Zusammenfassungen der Geschichte wirtschaftlichen Gedankenguts zusammen - wobei die Ideen Ricardos nat쬦lich gut wegkamen. Sein monumentales Traktat von 1837 bietet eine statistische Auff쬦rung des Scheiterns der malthusischen Bev쬦kerungstheorie.
column7: Prol쬦ico periodista escoc쬦, John Ramsay McCulloch fue uno de los m쬦 apasionados y doctrinarios exponentes de la escuela ricardiana cl쬦ica. McCulloch comenz쬦su carrera como redactor de 'The Scotsman'. Con el tiempo se traslad쬦al 'Edinburgh Review', de tendencia whig, donde trabaj쬦como redactor de econom쬦 hasta finales de la d쬦ada de 1930. McCulloch utiliz쬦su posici쬦 en 'Review' para divulgar las teor쬦s cl쬦icas y promover sus pol쬦icas econ쬦icas favoritas, como la derogaci쬦 de las Leyes del Trigo, la retenci쬦 de la Ley de Pobres y la legalizaci쬦 de los sindicatos. Tambi쬦 dio clases de econom쬦 pol쬦ica en la universidad de Londres desde 1828 hasta 1832. En 1838 fue nombrado interventor de la oficina permanente de Su Majestad. Puede que la obra principal de McCulloch, 'Principios' (1825), fuera el primer libro de texto 'serio' de Econom쬦 (y una lectura bastante fiel de la teor쬦 de Ricardo). No obstante, a menudo es considerado un 'peso ligero' en cuanto al desarrollo de la teor쬦 econ쬦ica. Su principal contribuci쬦 fue la desafortunada doctrina de 'fondo de salarios' (1824, 1825 y 1826). McCulloch fue tambi쬦 director de la edici쬦 de 1828 de 'La Riqueza de las Naciones' de Adam Smith y de la edici쬦 de las obras de David Ricardo. Tambi쬦 redact쬦algunas de las primeras relaciones de la historia del pensamiento econ쬦ico (naturalmente, favoreciendo a los ricardianos).  Su tratado monumental de 1837 proporciona un informe estad쬦tico del fracaso de la doctrina malthusiana sobre la poblaci쬦.

column2: 존 스튜어트 밀은 공리주의자로 알려진 제임스 밀의 아들입니다. 그가 발표한 다수의 저서 중에서는 '논리학 체계(1843년)', '경제학 원리(1848년)', '자유론(1859년)', '대의 통치론(1861년)' 그리고 '실용론(1861년)'이 유명합니다.
column3: John Stuart Mill was the son of James Mill, the famous utilitarian, he quickly became known as one of the more brilliant minds of the United Kingdom, and also one of the more radical. He published several books among them A System of Logic (1843), Principles of Political Economy (1848), On Liberty (1859), Considerations on Representative Government (1861) and Utilitarianism (1861), all of which made him the centre-figure of social liberalism and a more humane view of society.
column4: John Stuart Mill 쬦ait le fils de James Mill, le c쬦쬦re utilitaire, il est rapidement devenu connu comme l'un des esprits les plus brillants du Royaume-Uni, et aussi l'un des plus radical. Il a publi쬦plusieurs livres parmi eux : Syst쬦e de logique (1843), Principes d'쬦onomie politique (1848), De la libert쬦(1859), Consid쬦ations sur le gouvernement repr쬦entatif (1861) et l'utilitarisme (1861), qui fait de lui la figure de prou du social-liberalisme en une vision plus humaine de la soci쬦쬦
column5: John Stuart Mill war der Sohn des ber쬦mten Utilitariers James Mill. Er machte sich schnell einen Namen als einer der genialsten und radikalsten Denker Gro쬦ritanniens. Er ver쬦fentlichte mehrere B쬦her, darunter 'A System of Logic' (1843), 'Principles of Political Economy' (1848), 'On Liberty' (1859), 'Considerations on Representative Government' (1861) und 'Utilitarianism' (1861). Diese Werke machten ihn zu einer zentralen Figur des Sozialliberalismus und einer humaneren Betrachtung der Gesellschaft.
column7: John Stuart Mill fue el hijo de James Mill, el famoso utilitarista. R쬦idamente fue reconocido como una de las mentes m쬦 brillantes del Reino Unido, y tambi쬦 como una de las m쬦 radicales. Public쬦varios libros, entre ellos, 'Un sistema de l쬦ica' (1843), 'Principios de econom쬦 pol쬦ica' (1848), 'Sobre la libertad' (1859), 'Consideraciones sobre el gobierno representativo' (1861) y 'Utilitarismo' (1861). Todas ellas le convirtieron en la figura principal del socioliberalismo y de una visi쬦 m쬦 humana de la sociedad.

column2: 캘리포니아는 한 때 너무 커서 알래스카의 차가운 물에서부터 암 열대 지방의 뜨거운 바람까지 뻗었습니다. 캘리포니아는 한때 매우 컸으며, 사막, 평야, 바다, 그리고 모든 형태와 형태의 산들을 포함했습니다! 캘리포니아는 한때 매우 훌륭했었고, 탐험가들은 이 섬을 섬이라고 생각했고, 그 이름을 따서 만이라는 이름이 지어졌어요! 캘리포니아는 한때 매우 영광스러웠습니다. 모든 종류의 사람들이 망명을 찾게 됐습니다. 모르몬, 금도자, 야심찬 농부들과 사업가들, 망명자들, 멕시코인과 미국 원주민들이 함께 모여서 밝은 미래를 향해 행진했습니다. 저는 지금이 바로 우리의 것을 되찾을 때라고 말합니다!
column3: The people have called on us to unite under the California banner. Long live the Sons of Liberty!

column2: 북미 대륙에 대한 우리의 입장과 캐나다와의 전통적인 문화적 관계는 캐나다와의 연방 가입에 협상을 가능하게 합니다. 이는 우리나라가 캐나다에 합병됨을 의미합니다.
column3: Our position on the North American continent, and our traditional cultural ties to Canada, make it likely that Canada would be willing to negotiate our entrance into confederation. Doing this means our country will be annexed by Canada.

column2: 인민들은 우리에게 자유미국의 깃발 아래 단결할 것을 요구했습니다. 자유의 아들들 만세!
column3: The people have called on us to unite under the new FSA banner. Long live the Sons of Liberty!

column2: 성장하고 있는 스칸디나비아의 동맹에 참여할 때가 왔습니다.
column3: The time has come for our nation to take part in the growing Scandinavian union.

column2: 인민들은 우리에게 신미국의 깃발 아래 단결할 것을 요구했습니다. 자유의 아들들 만세!
column3: The people have called on us to unite under the New America banner. Long live the Sons of Liberty!

column2: 인민들은 우리에게 남부맹방의 깃발 아래 단결할 것을 요구했습니다. 남부 만세!
column3: The people have called on us to unite under the new Confederate banner. Long live the South!

column2: 베이징을 장악하고 있어 국민당의 대의를 도울 수 있습니다. 국민당의 군대와 합류해야 합니다.
column3: Now that we control Beijing, we are in a position to aid the cause of Nationalist China. We must join our forces with theirs, for the good of all!

column2: 합자회사는 회사가 효율적인 방법으로 자본 도입을 할 가능성을 증가시킵니다. 또한 개인 투자가는 어느정도의 위험에 대한 대가로 높은 투자효율을 얻을 수 있게 됐습니다.
column3: This legislation increased the possibilities for firms to get infusions of capital in an effective way. It also gave private investors the highest possible return on investment at a certain risk.
column4: Cette l쬦islation am쬦iorait les possibilit쬦 qu'avaient les entreprises de collecter des capitaux de mani쬦e efficace. Elle fournissait aussi aux investisseurs priv쬦 le meilleur retour sur investissement possible, 쬦un certain risque.
column5: Dieses Gesetz erh쬦te die M쬦lichkeiten von Firmen, auf effiziente Art und Weise an Geldspritzen zu kommen. Dar쬦er hinaus gab es Privatinvestoren bei einem gewissen Risiko die gr秤tm쬦liche Kapitalrendite.
column7: Esta legislaci쬦 aument쬦las posibilidades de que las empresas consiguieran inversiones de capital de una forma eficaz. Tambi쬦 dio a los inversores privados el mayor beneficio posible por una inversi쬦 a cambio de cierto riesgo.

column2: 앙투안-앙리 조미니는 프랑스와 러시아의 장군으로 나폴레옹 전쟁의 예술에 대해 유명한 작가들 중 하나였습니다. 사상자를 줄이기 위해서는 대치하는 병력을 최소로 유지해야 하며 전쟁은 예술이 아닌 과학이라는 견해를 취했습니다. 러시아에서 복무하는 동안, 조미니는 자신이 발견한 장교사관학교에서 더 과학적인 접근을 장려하기 위해 열심히 노력했습니다.
column3: Antoine-Henri Jomini was a general in the French and later Russian service, and one of the most celebrated writers on the Napoleonic art of war. He took the view that the amount of force deployed should be kept to the minimum in order to lower casualties and that war was a science, not an art. While in Russian service, Jomini tried hard to promote a more scientific approach at the general staff academy he helped found.

column2: 조지프 리스터는 영국의 외과의사이자 소독 수술의 선구자로, 글래스고 왕립 의무실에서 일하는 동안 무균 수술을 홍보했습니다. 리스터는 석탄산을 성공적으로 도입해 수술 기구를 소독하고 상처를 치료해 수술 후 감염을 줄이고 환자들에게 보다 안전하게 수술을 할 수 있게 하였습니다.
column3: Joseph Lister was a British surgeon and a pioneer of antiseptic surgery, who promoted the idea of sterile surgery while working at the Glasgow Royal Infirmary. Lister successfully introduced carbolic acide to sterilise surgical instruments and to clean wounds, which led to reducing post-operative infections and made surgery safer for patients.

column2: 요제프(조지프) 슘페터는 빈에서 순식간에 법학박사 학위를 취득한 후 1909년에 조교수로 학계에 복귀할 때까지 자유로운 변호사로 이곳저곳을 방랑했습니다. 그는 체르니우치(현 우크라이나령 체르노비치)에서 교수로 재직하는 동안 쓴 저서 '경제 발전의 이론(1911년)'에서 그 유명한 기업가 이론('혁신이론'으로 알려진)을 탄생시켰습니다. 기업가 이론은 대담한 기업가들은 경쟁과 이윤 감소에 직면하고도 기술적, 금융적 혁신을 창출하고, 이러한 활동 분류가 (불규칙한)경제 성장을 낳는다는 것입니다. 1919년에 슘페터는 그 학식으로 오스트리아 재무장관에 취임했습니다. 그러나 제1차 세계대전 패전의 영향으로 발생한 초인플레이션은 그도 어쩔수 없었기 때문에 그 해 중에 사임했습니다. 이후 그는 미국으로 건너가 하버드 대학에서 교수로 재직하면서 세 권의 책을 집필했습니다.  교훈적인 '경기 순환 이론(1939년)'과 인기를 끈 '자본주의, 사회주의, 민주주의(1942년)' 그리고 그의 사후 유고를 정리한 '경제 분석의 역사(1954년)'입니다. '자본주의, 사회주의, 민주주의'는 자본주의가 성공하면 거대 기업을 낳고, 이것이 관료화되어 활력을 잃으면 사회주의로 이행한다는 유명한 이론을 제시한 것으로 유명합니다.
column3: After a quick doctorate at Vienna, Schumpeter roamed about as something of a footloose lawyer until he rejoined academia in 1909. It was while he was teaching at Czernowitz (now in the Ukraine) that he wrote his Theory of Economic Development (1911), where he first outlined his famous theory of entrepreneurship. He argued those daring spirits, entrepreneurs, created technical and financial innovations in the face of competition and falling profits - and that it was these spurts of activity which generated (irregular) economic growth. In 1919, Schumpeter became the Austrian Minister of Finance - unfortunately, presiding over the hyperinflation of the period, and thus was dismissed later that year. Although excelling as a teacher above everything, Joseph Schumpeter nonetheless completed three more books while at Harvard: his didactic Business Cycles (1939), his popular Capitalism, Socialism and Democracy (1942) - in which he famously predicted the downfall of capitalism in the hands of intellectuals.
column5: Nach seinem Studium in Wien arbeitete Schumpeter einige Zeite als ungebundener Rechtsanwalt, bis er 1909 seine akademische Karriere fortsetzte. W쬦rend er in Czernowitz (heute in der Ukraine) unterrichtete, schrieb er seine 'Theorie der wirtschaftlichen Entwicklung' (1911), worin er zum ersten Mal seine ber쬦mte Theorie der Gesch쬦tsf쬦rung umriss. Er argumentierte, dass Unternehmer wagemutige Menschen seien, die im Angesicht gro쬦r Konkurrenz und fallender Profite technische und finanzielle Innovationen lieferten - und dass es diese Aktivit쬦ssch쬦e seien, die (unregelm癌iges) Wirtschaftswachstum erzeugten. 1919 wurde Schumpeter zum 쬦terreichischen Finanzminister ernannt. Leider hatte er das Amt w쬦rend der damaligen Hyperinflationsphase inne und wurde nach sieben Monaten wieder entlassen. Neben seiner exzellenten Lehrt쬦igkeit schrieb Joseph Schumpeter w쬦rend seiner Zeit an der Harvard-Universit쬦 drei weitere B쬦her, darunter sein didaktisches Werk 'Konjunkturzyklen' (1939) und sein popul쬦es Buch 'Kapitalismus, Sozialismus und DemokratieKapitalismus, Sozialismus und Demokratie(1942) - in dem er auf gl쬦zende Art und Weise den Niedergang des Kapitalismus in den H쬦den der Intellektuellen voraussagte.
column7: Tras un r쬦ido doctorado en Viena, Schumpeter hizo sus pinitos como abogado independiente hasta que volvi쬦al mundo acad쬦ico en 1909.  Fue mientras daba clase en Czernowitz (ahora en Ucrania) cuando escribi쬦su 'Teor쬦 de desarrollo econ쬦ico' (1911), donde perfil쬦por primera vez su famosa teor쬦 sobre el empresariado. Argumentaba que esos esp쬦itus valientes, los empresarios, crearon innovaciones t쬦nicas y financieras a causa de la competencia y de los beneficios decrecientes (y que fueron esas rachas de actividad las que generaron un irregular crecimiento econ쬦ico). En 1919, Schumpeter se convirti쬦en el ministro austr쬦co de Econom쬦. Desgraciadamente, presidi쬦durante un periodo de hiperinflaci쬦, por lo que a finales de ese a쬦 fue destituido. Aunque fue un excelente profesor, Joseph Schumpeter escribi쬦varios libros durante su estancia en Harvard: sus did쬦ticos 'Ciclos de los negocios' (1939) y su famoso 'Capitalismo, Socialismo y Democracia' (1942), donde predijo la ca쬦a del capitalismo a manos de los intelectuales.

column2: 쥘르 디피는 프랑스인 중에서 토목, 경제 두 분야에서 큰 업적을 남긴 인물입니다. 파리 국립토목학교에서 토목 기술을 배운 그는 파리의 상하수도를 정비하는 등 토목기사로서 뛰어난 업적을 남겼습니다. 사회기반시설에 관해 새 개념을 제시한 그는 경제이론을 더욱 심화시켰습니다.
column3: Jules Dupuit was perhaps the most illustrious of the French engineer-economists. Trained at the 쬦ole des Ponts et Chauss쬦s in Paris, Dupuit had a distinguished career as a civil engineer. From his work with infrastructure he was inspired to develop economic theory deeper.

Er war am 쬦ole des Ponts et Chauss쬦s in Paris ausgebildet worden und hatte eine herausragende Karriere als Bauingenieur gehabt. Seine Infrastrukturarbeit inspirierte ihn, seine wirtschaftlichen Theorien weiter zu vertiefen.

La inspiraci쬦 para desarrollar m쬦 profundamente la teor쬦 econ쬦ica le lleg쬦de su trabajo con infraestructuras.

column2: 칼 구스타프 융은 스위스 정신과 의사이자 영향력 있는 사상가이며 분석심리의 창시자입니다. 융은 종종 인간의 정신이 '자연적으로 종교적인 것'이라고 말하고 그것을 심도 있게 탐구한 최초의 현대 심리학자로 여겨집니다. 가장 먼저 꿈을 분석지는 않았지만, 현대에는 꿈 분석 분야에서 가장 잘 알려진 선구자 중 한명으로 여겨집니다. 프로이트와 달리, 그는 이론적 심리학자가 아니라 자연과학자였습니다. 융에게 있어서 이러한 두드러진 구별은 어떤 범주가 존재하는지 상상하고 그 다음에 증거를 찾는 역방향의 과정이 아니라 분류에 의한 그의 초기 관찰 과정을 중심으로 이루어졌습니다.
column3: Carl Gustav Jung was a Swiss psychiatrist, an influential thinker, and the founder of analytical psychology. Jung is often considered the first modern psychologist to state that the human psyche is 'by nature religious' and to explore it in depth. Those not the first to analyze dreams, he has become perhaps one of the most well-known pioneers in the field of dream analysis. Unlike Freud, he was a self-described natural scientist and not a theoretical psychologist. For Jung this salient distinction revolved around his initial process of deep observation followed by categorizations rather than the reverse process of imagining what categories exist and then proceeding to seek for proof of and then discover that one was correct.

column2: 독일 황제의 이름을 따서 명명된 '카이저빌헬름란트'는 비스마르크군도 및 기타 태평양군도와 함께 독일의 니우기니 식민지를 구성하는 니우기니(뉴기니)섬 북동부의 독일식 이름입니다. 이 영토는 제1차 세계대전 당시 호주군에게 점령됐고 1975년까지 국제연맹의 위임통치령 지위를 유지했습니다.
column3: Named after the German Emperor, 'Kaiser-Wilhelms-Land' was the German name for the North Eastern Part of the island of New Guinea, which, together with the Bismarck Archipelago and other pacific holdings constituted the German colony of Neuguinea. The territory was occupied by Australian troops during World War One, and held as a League of Nations mandate until 1975.

Das Territorium wurde w쬦rend des ersten Weltkriegs von australischen Truppen besetzt und stand bis 1975 unter dem Mandat der Vereinten Nationen.

El territorio, ocupado por tropas australianas durante la I Guerra Mundial, qued쬦bajo la administraci쬦 de la Liga de las Naciones hasta 1975.

column2: 다른 스칸디나비아 국가들과 더 긴밀한 유대를 갖자는 원칙에 합의했습니다.
column3: We have agreed in principle to a closer bond with the other Scandinavian nations.

column2: 일본에 압력을 가해 협상장에 불러들이는데 성공했습니다. 곧 가나가와에서 일본의 문호를 개방하고 우리의 종주권을 인정하는 조약을 체결할 것입니다.
column3: With enough pressure placed on the Japanese, they will be forced to the negotiating table. A treaty can be hammered out at Kanagawa which will see Japan opened to outside trade and influence, and our superiority proven beyond the shadow of a doubt.

column2: 캔자스-네브라스카법을 제정해 1820년 미주리 타협을 사실상 무효화합니다. 그리고 과거 루이지애나 지역의 신생주들의 노예제 찬성 여부를 주민투표에 맡기기로 했습니다. 노예제 폐지론자들은 이 법안에 분개하겠지만 연합의 분열을 막기 위한 필수적 조치입니다.
column3: By enacting The Kansas-Nebraska act we will effectively repeal the Missouri Compromise of 1820, and allow popular sovereignty to determine whether slavery should or should not be allowed in the former Colony of Louisiana, and the territories presently created out of it. Abolitionists will resent us for it, but it might be necessary to prevent the sundering of our Union.
column4: En promulgant l'acte Kansas-Nebraska nous allons effectivement abroger le compromis du Missouri de 1820, et permettre 쬦la souverainet쬦populaire de d쬦erminer si l'esclavage devrait ou ne devrait pas 쬦re autoris쬦dans l'ancienne colonie de la Louisiane, et dans les territoires cr釪s 쬦partir de celui-ci. Les abolitionnistes nous en voudront pour cela, mais c'est un mal n쬦essaire pour emp쬦her la fracture de l'Union.
column5: Durch Verabschiedung des Kansas-Nebraska Act w쬦den wir im Prinzip den Missouri Compromise von 1820 aufheben und die Volkssouver쬦it쬦 dar쬦er entscheiden lassen, ob die Sklaverei in der fr쬦eren Kolonie Louisiana und den daraus entstandenen Territorien erlaubt werden soll. column2: 1876년에 시행된 '카눈이아사시'(기본법)는 오스만 제국의 헌법을 제정하려는 시도입니다. 이 기본법은 술탄 압둘하미드 2세가 폐지하기 전까지 2년 동안만 유효하지만, 오스만과 터키의 입헌주의 발전의 중요한 전조입니다.
column3: Implemented in 1876, the 'Kanun-i-Easasi' (Basic Law) was an early attempt at gifting the Ottoman Empire with a constitution. While the Basic Law would only remain in effect for two years before being repealed by Sultan Abdulhamid II, it was nevertheless an important forerunner to the later development of Ottoman and Turkish constitutionalism.

column5: Das im Jahr 1876 verabschiedete 'Kanun-i-Esasi' (Grundgesetz) war ein fr쬦er Versuch, das osmanische Reich mit einer Verfassung auszustatten. Obwohl das Grundgesetz nur zwei Jahre in Kraft war, bevor es von Sultan Abdulhamid II. aufgehoben wurde, war es dennoch ein wichtiger Vorl쬦fer der sp쬦eren Entwicklung des osmanischen und t쬦kischen Konstitutionalismus.
column7: Promulgada en 1876, la 'Kanun-i-Easasi' (ley b쬦ica) represent쬦el primer intento de dotar al Imperio Otomano de una constituci쬦. Aunque solo permanecer쬦 vigente durante dos a쬦s, hasta su derogaci쬦 por parte del Sult쬦 Abdulhamid II, supuso un importante precedente en el posterior desarrollo del constitucionalismo otomano y turco.

column2: 카렌 호나이는 독일의 정신분석가입니다. 그녀는 프로이트가 성을 강조하는 것과 공격적인 것이 동기부여를 하는 원동력이라는 주장을 비난했습니다. 호니(1937년)는 인간의 중심적이고 선천적인 욕구로서 보안에 초점을 맞췄습니다. 그녀의 견해로는, 아이의 '기본적인 불안' 감정에 대한 부모의 성취에 달려있다고 봅니다. 성공하는 사람은 신뢰할 수 있는 사람으로, 실패하는 사람은 불안으로 이어집니다. 불안과 불신은 회피, 복종 또는 지배적인 성격으로 드러납니다.
column3: Karen Horney was a German psychoanalyst. She came to criticize Freud's emphasis on sex and aggressive as motivating drives. Horney (1937) focused on security instead as the central, inborn human need. In her view, child development was contingent upon parental fulfillment of the child's 'basic anxiety' emotion. Success would result in a trusting individual, while failure would result in insecurity. Insecurity and distrust manifests itself in personality as either avoidance, submission or dominance.

column2: 카를 카우츠키는 사회민주당에 입당해 사회민주당을 마르크스주의의 발전 형태에 관여시키고 '에르푸르트 강령'의 초안을 작성했습니다. 또한 그는 '카를 마르크스 경제이론(1887년)'과 '토마스 모어와 유토피아(1888년)'를 집필, 발표했습니다. 카우츠키는 후에 베른슈타인과 결별했습니다. 이는 사회주의의 혁명적 견해를 높여야 한다고 생각했던 카우츠키에게 베른슈타인의 의견은 지나치게 관용적이었기 때문입니다.
column3: Karl Kautsky joined the Social Democrat Party (SDP) and was responsible for drafting the Erfurt Program which committed the SDP to an evolutionary form of Marxism. He also wrote and published The Economic Doctrines of Karl Marx (1887) and Thomas Moore and His Utopia (1888). After a while he broke with Bernstein, whom he viewed to lenient and instead stayed true to his more revolutionary view of socialism.
column4: Karl Kautsky a rejoint le parti social-d쬦ocrate (SDP) et a 쬦쬦charg쬦de r쬦iger le programme d'Erfurt qui engagea le SDP comme une forme 쬦olutive du marxisme. Il a 쬦alement 쬦rit et publi쬦les doctrines 쬦onomiques de Karl Marx (1887) et Thomas Moore et son Utopie (1888). Apr쬦 un certain temps, il rompt avec Bernstein, qu'il consid쬦ait comme trop cl쬦ent et, 쬦la place, il est rest쬦fid쬦e 쬦son point de vue plus r쬦olutionnaire du socialisme.
column5: Karl Kautsky trat der Sozialdemokratischen Partei Deutschlands (SPD) bei und war f쬦 die Formulierung des Erfurter Programms verantwortlich, mit dem sich die SPD einer evolution쬦en Form des Marxismus verschrieb. Au쬦rdem schrieb und ver쬦fentlichte er 'Die wirtschaftlichen Theorien des Karl Marx' (1887) und 'Thomas Moore und seine Utopie (1888). Nach einer Weile brach er mit Bernstein, den er f쬦 zu gem癌igt hielt, und blieb stattdessen seiner eigenen, revolution쬦eren Betrachtung des Sozialismus treu.
column7: Karl Kautsky se uni쬦al Partido Social-Dem쬦rata (SDP) y fue responsable del anteproyecto del Programa Erfurt, que comprometi쬦al SDP a ser una forma evolucionada de Marxismo. Tambi쬦 escribi쬦y public쬦'Las doctrinas econ쬦icas de Karl Marx' (1887) y 'Tom쬦 Moro y su utop쬦' (1888). column2: 카를 크니스의 선형발전론은 대부분의 이론을 시대착오적인 것이라는 '도덕적 발전'을 나타냈습니다. 그러나 그의 1873년 연구에는 역사학파적인 관점이 거의 없었습니다. 그는 정치적 활동으로 인해 1848년에 일시적으로 망명을 할 수 밖에 없었습니다. 그의 저서로는 '정치경제학-역사론의 관점에서(1853년)'나 '화폐와 신용(1873년)' 등이 있습니다.
column3: Knies's linear stages argument spoke of 'moral progress' which would render most theories obsolete. His 1873 work, however, contained little of the historical method in it. His political involvements earned him temporary exile in 1848. He wrote Political Economy from the Standpoint of the Historical Method (1853), and Money and Credit (1873).
column4: L'argument lin쬦ire par 쬦apes de Knies, parle de 쳎rogr쬦 moral쬦qui rendrait la plupart des th쬦ries obsol쬦es. Son travail de 1873, cependant, ne contenait que peu de la m쬦hode historique en lui. Ses engagements politiques lui ont valu l'exil temporaire en 1848. Il a 쬦rit l'쬦onomie politique du point de vue de la m쬦hode historique (1853), et de l'argent et de cr쬦it (1873).
column5: Knies' lineares Stufenmodell bezog sich auf die moralische Entwicklung, was die meisten anderen Theorien 쬦erholt aussehen lie쬦 Sein Werk von 1873 enthielt jedoch wenig von dieser historischen Methodik. Sein politisches Engagement brachten ihm 1848 die vor쬦ergehende Verbannung ins Exil ein. Er schrieb 'Die politische 쬦onomie vom Standpunkt der geschichtlichen Methode' (1853) sowie 'Geld und Kredit' (1873).

column2: 카를 마르크스는 원래 헤겔의 신봉자였으나 점차 자신만의 이상주의적 철학을 발전시켜 갔습니다. 파리 체류기 후반, 그는 처음으로 노동자와 교제했으며 그들의 빈곤에 충격을 받았으며 동시에 노동자들 간의 동지의식에 감동했습니다. '독일-프랑스 연보'를 위해 쓴 기사 중에서 마르크스는 헤겔의 변증법 이론을 자신이 파리에서 관찰한 사물에 대입했습니다. 이때부터 마르크스는 공산주의자라고 자칭하고, 노동자 계급(프롤레타리아트)은 최종적으로 사회적 해방자가 된다고 주장했습니다. 마르크스의 저서 중에서도 특히 영향이 컸던 것이 '독일 이념', '공산당 선언', '공산주의의 원리' 그리고 '자본론'입니다. 그는 삶의 대부분을 영국에서 보내며 저서를 발표해 가장 영향력 있는 사회주의자가 됐습니다.
column3: Karl Marx was originally disciple of Hegel, but evolved his idealistic philosophy. Later in Paris he began mixing with members of the working class for the first time. Marx was shocked by their poverty but impressed by their sense of comradeship. In an article that he wrote for the Franco-German Annals, Marx applied Hegel's dialectic theory to what he had observed in Paris. Marx, who now described himself as a communist, argued that the working class (the proletariat), would eventually be the emancipators of society. Marx' most influential works were, The German Ideology, The Communist Manifesto, Principles of Communism, and Das Kapital. For most of his life he lived in England where he published his works and from where he became the most influential socialist of all time.
column4: Karl Marx a 쬦쬦쬦l'origine disciple de Hegel, mais a 쬦olu쬦vers sa philosophie id쬦liste. Plus tard, 쬦Paris, il commence 쬦se m쬦anger pour la premi쬦e fois, avec les membres de la classe ouvri쬦e. Marx a 쬦쬦choqu쬦par leur pauvret쬦 mais impressionn쬦par leur sens de la camaraderie. Dans un article qu'il a 쬦rit pour les Annales franco-allemandes, Marx a appliqu쬦la th쬦rie dialectique de Hegel 쬦ce qu'il avait observ쬦쬦Paris. Marx, qui maintenant se d쬦rit comme un communiste, fait valoir que la classe ouvri쬦e (le prol쬦ariat), serait finalement l'쬦ancipateur de la soci쬦쬦 Les travaux les plus influents de Marx ont 쬦쬦: L'Id쬦logie allemande, Le Manifeste du Parti communiste, Principes du communisme, et Das Kapital. Durant une bonne partie de sa vie, il a v쬦u en Angleterre o쬦il publia ses 쐕vres et d'o쬦il dev쬦t le socialiste le plus influent de tous les temps.
column5: Karl Marx war urspr쬦glich ein Sch쬦er von Hegel, entwickelte aber seine eigene idealistische Philosophie. In Paris traf er sp쬦er dann erstmals mit Angeh쬦igen der Arbeiterklasse zusammen. Marx war von ihrer Armut schockiert, aber ihre Kameradschaft beeindruckte ihn. In einem Artikel f쬦 die deutschfranz쬦ischen Annalen wandte Marx Hegels dialektische Theorie auf das in Paris Gesehene an. Marx, der sich nun als Kommunist bezeichnete, behauptete darin, dass die Arbeiterklasse (das Proletariat) letztendlich zum Befreier der Gesellschaft werden w쬦de. Marx' einflussreichste Werke waren 'Die deutsche Ideologie', 'Manifest der Kommunistischen Partei' und 'Das Kapital'. Er lebte den Gro쬦eil seines Lebens in England, wo er seine Werke ver쬦fentlichte und zum einflussreichsten Sozialisten aller Zeiten wurde.
column7: Karl Marx fue originariamente disc쬦ulo de Hegel, pero su filosof쬦 idealista evolucion쬦 Tiempo despu쬦, en Par쬦, comenz쬦a mezclarse con miembros de la clase obrera por primera vez. Qued쬦impactado por su pobreza, pero tambi쬦 impresionado por su sentido de la camarader쬦. column2: 욘 구스타프 크누트 빅셀은 장기균형 이자율을 설명할 때 '자연'이라는 단어가 자주 사용되는 계기를 만든 스웨덴의 경제학자였습니다. 또한 경제학자 제임스 M 뷰캐넌에 지대한 영향을 미친 인물이기도 합니다. 뷰캐넌은 그의 '공공선택론'에 대해 대부분이 "(빅셀이 창시한) 스웨덴학파의 이론을 나름대로 흡수한 당연한 결과"라고 말합니다. 또 정부가 마치 자비로운 전제군주처럼 행세한다면 경제학자는 그것을 바꾸어야 한다고도 말합니다. 빅셀은 맬서스주의자였으며 산아제한을 강하게 옹호했으며 종종 도덕적인 문제에 관해서도 의견을 표명했습니다. 저서 중 가장 유명한 '이자와 물가'에서 화폐수량이론을 전개했습니다. 그가 전개한 이론은 당시의 표준적인 견해와 달리 화폐 공급이 물가에 미치는 간접적 영향에 주목하는 것이었습니다. 빅셀은 한계 생산력설에 대해서도 상술하고, 생산에 관련된 각각의 요인에 대한 지불은 요인의 한계 생산력과 동일하다고 했습니다. 게다가 자원의 효율적 할당이 공정한 배분을 보장하는 것이 아니라고 언급했습니다. 그 이유를 그는 기존의 수입 배분이 할당 모양을 결정하지만 기존의 수익 배분은 반드시 공평하지 않기 때문이라고 하였습니다. 나중에 빅셀의 수량과 물가에 관한 이론을 바탕으로 스웨덴학파는 독자적인 거시경제학을 전개하게 됐습니다.
column3: He was a Swedish economist whose work led to the widespread use of the word 'natural' to explain the long-run equilibrium rate of interest. Wicksell had a tremendous influence on economist James M. Buchanan. According to Buchanan, his theory of public choice 'was an almost natural consequence of my absorption of the Wicksellian message,' which stated that economists must cease acting as if government were a benevolent despot. Wicksell was a Malthusian and a strong advocate of birth control. He spoke out on moral issues quite often. He is best known for his work in 'Interest and Prices', in which he laid out his version of the quantity theory of money. His version was different from the standard view at that time in that he looked at the indirect effect that the money supply has on prices. Wicksell also elaborated on the theory of marginal productivity, which states that the payment to each factor of production equals that factors marginal productivity. He also stated that an efficient allocation of resources does not guarantee equitable distribution, because the preexisting distribution of income determines what form this allocation will take, and the preexisting distribution of income is not always just. The Stockholm School developed its own version of macroeconomics, which was based on Wicksell's work on quantity and price theory.
column5: Er war ein schwedischer 쬦onom, der den Begriff des nat쬦lichen Zinssatzes in die 쬦onomische Theorie einf쬦rte. Wicksell hatte enormen Einfluss auf den 쬦onomen James M. Buchanan. Laut Buchanan war seine Public Choice Theory eine 'fast nat쬦liche Konsequenz auf meine Besch쬦tigung mit dem Wicksellianen Gedanken'. Dessen Hauptaussage wiederum war, dass 쬦onomen damit aufh쬦en sollten, sich so zu verhalten, als w쬦en Regierungen wohlwollende Despoten. Wicksell war ein Malthusianer und entschiedener Verfechter der Geburtenkontrolle und 쬦쬦rste sich oft zu moralischen Fragen. Er ist vor allem f쬦 sein Werk 'Geldzins und G쬦erpreise' bekannt, in dem er seine Version der monet쬦en Quantit쬦stheorie pr쬦entiert. Seine Version unterschied sich dahingehend von der damals meistverbreitetsten Ansicht, dass er den indirekten Effekt des Geldumlaufs auf die Preise untersuchte. Wicksell f쬦rte auch die Theorie der marginalen Produktivit쬦 weiter aus, die aussagt, dass die Bezahlung jedes Produktionsfaktors gleich dessen marginaler Produktivit쬦 ist. Au쬦rdem legte er dar, dass eine effiziente Ressourcenverteilung keine gerechte Verteilung garantierte, da die gegebene Einkommensverteilung vorbestimmt, welche Form diese Ressourcenverteilung annimmt, und diese gegebene Einkommensverteilung ist nicht immer gerecht sei. Die Stockholmer Schule entwickelte ihre eigene, auf Wicksells Arbeit an der Quantit쬦s- und Preistheorie aufbauende Version der Makro쬦onomie.
column7: Fue un economista sueco cuya obra llev쬦al uso generalizado de la palabra 'natural' para explicar el equilibrio a la larga de la tasa de inter쬦. Wicksell tuvo una tremenda influencia en el economista James M.  Buchanan.  Seg쬦 Buchanan, su teor쬦 de la elecci쬦 p쬦lica 'fue una consecuencia casi natural' de su absorci쬦 del mensaje wickselliano, que expon쬦 que el economista debe dejar de actuar como si el gobierno fuera un ben쬦olo d쬦pota. Wicksell fue malthusiano y un firme defensor del control de la natalidad. A menudo hablaba muy claramente sobre cuestiones morales. Es m쬦 conocido por su trabajo en 'Inter쬦 y precios', donde expon쬦 su versi쬦 de la teor쬦 cuantitativa del dinero. Su versi쬦 se diferenciaba de la visi쬦 habitual de la 쬦oca en que 쬦 miraba el efecto indirecto que ten쬦 en los precios la masa monetaria. Wicksell tambi쬦 desarroll쬦la teor쬦 de la productividad marginal, que determina que el pago a cada factor de la producci쬦 iguala la productividad marginal de esos mismos factores. Tambi쬦 expuso que una asignaci쬦 eficaz de los recursos no garantiza una distribuci쬦 equitativa, porque la distribuci쬦 preexistente de la renta determina qu쬦forma adoptar쬦esa asignaci쬦, y esa distribuci쬦 no siempre es justa. column3: In 1870 'The Law of Guarantees' was a law passed by the newly formed Kingdom of Italy -- aimed at solving the 'Roman Question' -- that accorded the pope privileges similar to that of the King himself, including the right to send and receive ambassadors. While the issue was not conclusively solved until the Lateran Treaty of 1929, the Law of Guarantees nevertheless meant that the young Kingdom's capital would from then on be Rome.

column3: An Austrian economist who would challenge the growing influence of Keynesian economics upon the actions of the State in the 1930s. Von Mises was also a sharp critic of socialist economic models, arguing that such models removed the ability of the market to determine price levels that would ensure adequate supply based on the demands of consumers for goods
column5: Mises war ein 쬦terreichischer 쬦onom, der den wachsenden Einfluss der keynesianischen Wirtschaftskonzepts auf die Handlungen des Staats w쬦rend der 1930er Jahre kritisierte. Er behauptete, solche Modelle w쬦den die F쬦igkeit des Marktes eliminieren, Preisstufen zu ermitteln, die basierend auf der G쬦ernachfrage ein ad쬦uates Angebotsniveau gew쬦rleisten.

column3: As the twentieth century developed and the influence of alternative models of economic development outside the capitalist framework began to be implemented in certain societies, some politicians began to consider the possibility that merging what were considered the best elements from both capitalism and command economies could produce benefits for their society as a whole. While many more ideologically-driven critics of such policies argued the policies either went too far or not far enough in their transformations of the economy, the results of creating a mixed economic system in terms of both restoring economic production and reducing social tensions were often quite impressive.

column3: As the twentieth century evolved the role of wireless communication pioneered in the development of radio by Guglielmo Marconi would rapidly increase as technological changes improved the clarity and quality of radio transmissions. By the early 1920s the improvements would result in the development of a whole new medium of information exchange as radio frequencies could be used to transmit content designed to entertain, inform, or convince. Realizing the potential power of this new medium, states began to regulate the assigning of radio frequencies, with some establishing national monopolies while others allowed for the development of commercial broadcasting networks. By the early 1930s the radio set would become one of the most desired consumer goods, and its potential use to not only entertain but develop and shape public opinion would soon be seized upon by politicians and those who aspired to political power
column5: Im Verlauf des zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts wurde die drahtlose Kommunikation, deren Pionierarbeit Guglielmo Marcon mit der Erfindung des Radios geleistet hatte, zunehmend wichtiger, da der allgemeine technologische Fortschritt die Klarheit und allgemeine 쬦ertragungsqualit쬦 von Funkverbindungen verbesserte. column2: 19세기 후반부터 20세기 초까지 철학분야에서는 인간의 이성을 강조하는 생각에서 벗어나려는 경향이 꿈틀거리기 시작했습니다. 이러한 경향의 확립에 큰 영향을 끼친것은 일부 허무주의철학자 사이에 있었던 개인의 삶의 어떤 의미를 가지느냐의 문제, 우주의 장엄한 작용 속 잠재하는 핵심이라고 하는 문제에 대해 의미도, 의도도 존재하지 않는다는 생각이었습니다. 자아의 형성이나 존재로서의 개인의 가치 등의 문제에 대해 허무주의는 자기의 이익을 위해 상황에 개입하는 인간의 능력으로서의 '의사'에 초점을 맞추었습니다. 허무주의는 19세기 후반에 '프리드리히 니체(Friedrich Nietzsche)'의 일련의 저서를 통해 크게 발전하였습니다. 또 산업혁명 시기 이후 산업화의 영향을 받은 전쟁, 그 극적인 충격은 20세기 초의 대 철학자 '마틴 하이데거 (Martin Heidegger)'를 비롯한 철학자들에게 허무주의의 새로운 진전을 촉구하였습니다. 인간의 행동을 이끄는 것으로서의 절대 보편의 원리의 존재를 부정하는 허무주의는 빅토리아시대의 세계를 형성했던 가치관 등을 최종적으로 붕괴시키는 다양한 의문을 낳는 요인이 됐습니다. 한편 의사의 강조는 현재까지의 전통적 가치관이나 풍습에 대해 의문을 제기하거나 새로운 가치관을 만들어 낼때 도움이 됐습니다.
column3: The foundations for the trend away from the emphasis on human rationality in philosophy in the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries would be established with a revival in the interest among some philosophers in nihilism, the rejection of the idea that the life of the individual has any meaning or purpose in the grand workings of the universe. In place of the self-value of the individual as a being, focus was placed on The Will, the human ability to intervene in a situation to his own benefit. Developed most effectively in the writings of Friedrich Nietzsche in the late nineteenth century, the dramatic impact of warfare in the industrial era would lead to further refinement of the concept by philosophers such as Martin Heidegger in the early twentieth century. In its denial of the value of absolutes as guides for the conduct of human behavior, Nihilism would help contribute to the further questioning, and for many the ultimate rejection, of the values and beliefs that had shaped the Victorian world, while the emphasis on Will would encourage action to challenge accepted practices and encourage the construction of new values
column5: Die Grundlagen f쬦 den philosophischen Trend des sp쬦en neunzehnten und fr쬦en zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts, sich von der Betonung auf die menschliche Rationalit쬦 zu entfernen, wurden durch eine Erneuerung des Interesses einiger Philosophen am Nihilismus geschaffen, der Zur쬦kweisung des Gedanken, dass das Leben des einzelnen Individuums im gro쬦n Gef쬦e des Universums auch nur die geringste Bedeutung hat. An Stelle des Selbstwerts des Individuums als Wesen wurde der Hauptaugenmerk auf den Willen gelegt, der menschlichen F쬦igkeit, zum eigenen Vorteil in eine Situation einzugreifen. Wie am effizientesten in den Werken von Friedrich Nietzsche im sp쬦en neunzehnten Jahrhundert dargelegt, f쬦rte der dramatische Einfluss der Kriege des Industriezeitalters Anfang des zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts zur weiteren Verfeinerung des Konzepts durch Philosophen wie Martin Heidegger. Mit seiner Bestreitung des Werts des Absoluten als Hilfestellung f쬦 das menschliche Verhalten trug der Nihilismus zur weiteren Hinterfragung bei, und f쬦 viele letztendlich zur Ablehnung der Werte und 쬦erzeugungen, die die viktorianische Welt gepr쬦t hatten, w쬦rend die Betonung auf dem Willen Handlungen zur Herausforderung akzeptierter Gebr쬦che und zur Schaffung neuer Werte ermutigte.
column7: Los cimientos para una corriente que abandonar쬦 el 쬦fasis en el racionalismo humano en la filosof쬦 a finales del siglo XIX y principios del XX se pondr쬦n con el renacimiento del inter쬦 entre algunos fil쬦ofos por el tema del nihilismo, el rechazo a la idea de que la vida del individuo tiene alg쬦 significado o prop쬦ito en el universo. En lugar de centrarse en el valor del individuo como ser, estos pensadores prefer쬦n ocuparse de la voluntad, la capacidad de intervenir en una situaci쬦 en su propio beneficio. Desarrollado principalmente en las obras de Friedrich Nietzsche a finales del siglo XIX, este concepto ser쬦 perfeccionado a comienzos del siglo XX por fil쬦ofos como Martin Heidegger, como consecuencia del dram쬦ico impacto de la guerra en la sociedad industrial. Con su negaci쬦 de los conceptos absolutos como pautas para el comportamiento humano, el nihilismo contribuir쬦 a cuestionar (y, para muchos, a invalidar) los valores y certezas que hab쬦n dado su forma al mundo victoriano, mientras que el 쬦fasis en la voluntad promover쬦 la acci쬦 como v쬦 para derribar las pr쬦ticas aceptadas y la construcci쬦 de valores nuevos.

column2: 가르니에 극장은 1875년 개관부터 1989년까지 파리 오페라의 최고봉이었습니다. 신바로크 양식으로 찰스 가르니에가 설계한 이 오페라하우스는 당시 현대건축의 걸작으로 널리 평가받았고, 서양 전역에서 널리 모방햇습니다. 또한 개스톤 레룩스의 고전 소설 '오페라의 유령'에 영감을 주기도 했습니다.
column3: The Palais Garnier was, from its inauguration in 1875 to 1989, the chief home of the Paris Opera. column3: As a result of the huge manpower requirements of militaries in an age of industrial warfare, the restoration of peace often resulted in the creation of large numbers of veterans, many of whom found it difficult to adjust to a return to civilian life and who possessed basic military training that could be put to use if needed. With the growth of revolutionary movements on the Left and particularly on the Right, the potential use of disgruntled military veterans for the purpose of challenging the actions and influence of ideological opponents grew rapidly. Their existence and growth in times of political, social and economic upheaval proved challenging to the ability of many States to maintain law and order, and the activities of such paramilitaries were often cited by those opposed to Liberal Capitalism of the inherent weakness of democracy in the face of revolutionary challenges that threatened the social order

column2: 20세기 전반에 세계를 뒤흔든 일련의 경제위기를 계기로 일부 정치인은 수요와 공급 및 경제 위기때의 상호작용에 대한 새로운 경제 이론, 즉 '케인스 경제학'의 영향을 받게 됐습니다. 경제적 지출이 승수효과(multiplier effect)을 통해 새로운 경제활동을 유발한다는 개념을 바탕으로, 경제 침체기에 일부 정치인은 재정을 확대해 수요를 창출하고 다시 경제를 성장 기조에 놓기 위해 정부 지출을 증가시킬 것을 호소하였습니다. 하지만  모든 정치인이나 경제학자가 '케인스 경제학'에 근거해 이 주장을 지지한 것은 아니었습니다. 재정 확대로 수요는 창출하지만 국가의 경제 간섭이 사회주의적 경제체제 도입으로 이어지는 것을 경계해야 했습니다. 그러나 국가가 경제를 살리기 위해 적극적으로 행동한는 방침은 경기 침체로 인해 고통받던 사람들에게 매우 지지를 받았습니다.
column3: In wake of a series of economic shocks that shook the world in the first part of the twentieth century some politicians would become influenced by new economic theories regarding supply and demand and their interplay in times of economic crisis. Based upon the concept that money spent in the economy has a multiplier effect that increases economic activity by generating income that can contribute to new demand, some politicians made appeals in wake of economic declines for 몆riming the pump쬦to reinflate demand and thus resume economic growth. Not all politicians and economist accepted this argument, and to some such state intervention appeared as an introduction of socialist principles into the economy, but the political impact of having the State appear to be actively trying to improve economic conditions made such political promises very appealing to those negatively impacted by economic downturns.
column5: Als Folge einer Reihe wirtschaftlicher Schocks, die die Welt Anfang des zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts ersch쬦tert hatten, lie쬦n sich einige Politiker von neuen Wirtschaftstheorien bez쬦lich Angebot und Nachfrage und deren Wechselwirkung w쬦rend Wirtschaftskrisen beeinflussen. Ausgehend vom Konzept, dass in der Wirtschaft ausgegebenes Geld einen multiplizierenden Effekt hat, der die Wirtschaftsaktivit쬦 durch die Erzeugung von Einkommen verst쬦kt, was wiederum zu neuer Nachfrage beitragen kann, machten sich einige Politiker nach Wirtschaftseinbr쬦hen daf쬦 stark, zur Nachfragesteigerung und der damit einhergehenden Fortsetzung des Wirtschaftswachstums die Wirtschaft anzukurbeln. Dieses Argument wurde nicht von allen Politikern und 쬦onomen akzeptiert, und f쬦 manche erschien eine solche staatliche Einmischung in die Wirtschaft als Versuch, sozialistische Prinzipien einzuf쬦ren. Bas쬦dose en la idea de que el dinero invertido en la econom쬦 tiene un efecto multiplicador al generar ingresos que pueden contribuir a aumentar la demanda, algunos de sus miembros comenzaron a abogar por estimular la actividad econ쬦ica desde el gobierno para aumentar la demanda y as쬦relanzar el crecimiento. No todos los pol쬦icos y economistas aceptaban este argumento y a algunos este intervencionismo econ쬦ico les parec쬦 la introducci쬦 de los principios del socialismo en la econom쬦, pero la complicada situaci쬦 hizo que la promesa de que el Estado se implicar쬦 de manera directa en el fomento de la econom쬦 resultara muy atractiva para los afectados por las crisis.

column3: The dramatic expansion of scientific knowledge in the nineteenth century would lead to a questioning of the rational model of the basic structures of the universe that had culminated in the work of Isaac Newton in the late seventeenth century. As scientific equipment became more precise, discrepancies in the models of atomic behavior as understood in the nineteenth century resulted in further research into the nature of atomic particles and their interaction with forces such as energy. As a result of the work of physicists such as Albert Einstein and Werner Heisenberg, the idea that the basic structures of the universe could be known with precision by humans was shown to be incorrect, and an alternative view that there were elements of unpredictability in the structure and behavior of atomic particles would be proposed. While a major step forward in human understanding of the basic structures of matter, the emphasis of the random nature of some elements of the natural world further shook the Victorian faith in the ability of humanity to understand fully the natural world and reinforced the sense that the world was indeed not built upon completely rational behavior and assumptions
column5: Die dramatische Wissenserweiterung im neunzehnten Jahrhundert f쬦rte zur Hinterfragung des rationalen Modells der grundlegenden Strukturen des Universums, das im sp쬦en siebzehnten Jahrhundert mit der Arbeit von Isaac Newton seinen H쬦epunkt erreicht hatte. Als Ergebnis der Arbeit von Physikern wie Albert Einstein und Werner Heisenberg wurde die Vorstellung, Menschen k쬦nten die grundlegenden Strukturen des Universum pr쬦ise entschl쬦seln, als falsch bewiesen. Man schlug einen alternativen Ansatz vor, der besagte, dass es in der Struktur und im Verhalten von atomaren Partikeln unberechenbare Elemente gab. Obwohl dies ein gro쬦r Fortschritt des menschlichen Wissen um die grundlegenden Strukturen der Materie war, ersch쬦terte die Betonung auf die Zuf쬦ligkeit mancher nat쬦licher Elemente den viktorianischen Glauben an die F쬦igkeit der Menschheit, die Natur vollst쬦dig zu begreifen, in seinen Grundfesten, und st쬦kte die Ansicht, dass die Welt tats쬦hlich nicht auf vollst쬦dig rationalem Verhalten und Vermutungen gebaut war.
column7: El crecimiento exponencial del conocimiento cient쬦ico durante el siglo XIX llevar쬦 a cuestionar la visi쬦 racional de las estructuras del universo que hab쬦 culminado, a finales del siglo XVII, en la obra de Isaac Newton. column3: The 'Corn Laws' were a series of vastly unpopular tariffs, often described as a rare example of British mercantilism, designed to 'protect' British farmers and corn prices from cheap foreign competition, which, naturally, had the effect of effectively increasing corn prices for Britain's poor. After the failed harvest of 1845, and the following Potato Famine in Ireland, the Corn Laws were finally repealed in 1846. The failure of these tariffs heralded a long period of British commitment to the ideals of Laissez-faire capitalism, that was to last for most of the 19th century.
column4: Les "lois sur le grain" regroupaient une s쬦ie de droits de douanes tr쬦 impopulaires, souvent d쬦rites comme un rare exemple de mercantilisme britannique, con쬦es pour "prot쬦er" les fermiers anglais et les prix du bl쬦de la concurrence 쬦rang쬦e, ce qui, naturellement, avait pour effet d'augmenter les prix du bl쬦pour les plus pauvres. Apr쬦 la mauvaise r쬦olte de 1845 et la Grande Famine irlandaise, les lois sur le grain finirent par 쬦re abrog쬦s en 1846. L'쬦hec de ces droits de douane marqua le d쬦ut d'une longue p쬦iode d'engagement britannique 쬦l'쬦ard des id쬦ux du capitalisme laxiste qui allait perdurer pendant presque tout le XIXe si쬦le.

Mit diesen Einfuhrz쬦len sollte die britische Landwirtschaft vor der billigen ausl쬦dischen Konkurrenz 'gesch쬦zt' werden, aber nat쬦lich erh쬦te dies den Armen Englands nur die Kornpreise. Nach der Missernte von 1845 und der darauf folgenden Kartoffel-Hungersnot in Irland wurden die Korngesetze 1846 endlich aufgehoben. Das Scheitern dieser Z쬦le leite eine lange Periode britischer Verbundenheit mit den Idealen des Laissez Faire-Kapitalismus ein, die den Gro쬦eil des neunzehnten Jahrhunderts 쬦erspannte.

column4: Formally a British Overseas Territory, the Falkland Islands were the cause of the Falklands War between Argentina and the United Kingdom, during which Argentina invaded and occupied the Falkand Islands, attempting to establish the sovereignty it had long claimed over the islands. The conflict lasted 74 days before Argentina surrendered and returned the island to British control. At some point, British government lost control of the Falkland Islands. Now that they have been restored to our control, however, we have the option of renaming them!쬦

column3: An English economist who first developed the concept of the multiplier effect of spending in an economy in the early 1930s. At its base, this is the concept that spending in the economy for goods and services produced new potentials for demand by the providers of those initial goods and services, creating an expansion of demand beyond the initial value of the original spending. Adopted by John Maynard Keynes in his concept of the role of aggregate demand in the functioning of the economy, the concept of the multiplier effect would be increasingly adopted by States facing economic slowdowns by encouraging the State itself to increase its spending in the economy as a way to revive weakened demand and restore economic growth
column5: Kahn war ein englischer 쬦onom, der Anfang der 1930er Jahre das Konzept des Multiplikatoreffekts von Ausgaben in einer Wirtschaft entwickelt. Mit Hilfe dieses Konzepts sollte der Staat selbst seine Ausgaben in der Wirtschaft erh쬦en, um die geschw쬦hte Nachfrage wieder zu beleben und das Wirtschaftswachstum wieder anzukurbeln.

column3: Robert Torrens was a British army officer and owner of the influential Globe newspaper. column3: Rosendale cement generally refers to a type of natural cement that was produced in and around Rosendale,New York from argillaceous limestone,but is a term that has had different definitions at different times. column3: The Rotherham or Yorkshire Plough invented by Disney Stanyforth and Joseph Foljambe was an improvement on the traditional plough. column3: Webb developed socialist ideas while at university and in 1885 he joined the Fabian Society. The society believed that capitalism had created an unjust and inefficient society. The members agreed that the ultimate aim of the group should be to reconstruct 'society in accordance with the highest moral possibilities'. The Fabian Society was a 'fact-finding and fact-dispensing body' and it produced a series of pamphlets on a wide variety of different social issues. Many of these were written by Sidney Webb including Facts for Socialists (1887), Facts for Londoners (1888) and The Eight Hour Day (1891). Webb also wrote A Plan on Campaign for Labour with George Bernard Shaw. Webb later became an important socialdemocratic figure with influence in the international worker organizations.

column3: The impact of Jevons on economics can hardly be exaggerated.  As the father of Neoclassical economics, his legacy is secure.  However, in some ways, he stopped short of the mark.  Jevons could have gone further by connecting his insights in pure exchange into a wider theory incorporating production, capital, money and the business cycle in a more systematic and consistent manner that would have knocked the Ricardian School completely out of the picture.  Had he not died so young, Jevons might yet have done so, but the next economics treatise he was working on (published posthumously in 1905), did not really seem to go in that ambitious direction.  As such, by the time of his death, the Marginalist Revolution was still in its insurrectionist phase.  It was still a tentative proposition rather than a firmly-set and integrated system, a scientific hypothesis but not quite yet a science. It should be noted that Jevons made maybe as much for the subject of Logics as for economics, which is quite a feat.

Jevons aurait pu aller plus loin en reliant son point de vue en pur 쬦hange dans une plus large th쬦rie int쬦rant la production, le capital, l'argent et le cycle 쬦onomique d'une mani쬦e plus syst쬦atique et coh쬦ente qui aurait frapp쬦fortement l'쬦ole de Ricardo compl쬦ement hors jeu. S'il n'쬦ait pas mort si jeune, Jevons aurait pu encore le faire, mais le prochain trait쬦d'쬦onomie sur lequel il travaillait (publi쬦쬦titre posthume en 1905), ne semble pas vraiment aller dans cette direction ambitieuse. En tant que tel, au moment de sa mort, la r쬦olution marginaliste 쬦ait encore dans sa phase insurrectionnelle. Il convient de noter que Jevons a fait peut-쬦re autant pour le sujet des logiques que pour l'쬦onomie, ce qui est un exploit en soi.
column5: Der Einfluss von Jevons auf die Wirtschaftswissenschaften war von gr秤ter Bedeutung. Als Vater des neoklassischen Wirtschaftsansatzes ist sein Namen untrennbar mit der Geschichte verbunden. In manchen Fragen hielt er aber kurz vor dem Ziel an: Jevons h쬦te noch weiter gehen k쬦nen, wenn er seine Erkenntnisse in eine breitere, Produktions-, Geld-, und Gesch쬦tszyklen auf systematischere und konsistentere Weise integrierende Theorie h쬦te einflie쬦n lassen, welche die ricardische Schule komplett aus den Angeln gehoben h쬦te. W쬦e er nicht so jung gestorben, h쬦te er dies wahrscheinlich noch gemacht. Seine n쬦hste Wirtschaftsabhandlung (posthum im Jahr 1905 ver쬦fentlicht) ging jedoch nicht in diese ambitionierte Richtung, und so steckte die marginalistische Revolution zum Zeitpunkt seines Todes immer noch in ihrer aufr쬦rerischen Phase. Noch war sie mehr ein zaghafter Vorschlag als ein solide fundiertes und integriertes System ... eine wissenschaftliche Hypothese, aber noch keine Wissenschaft f쬦 sich. Jevons hat 쬦rigens f쬦 die Logik ebenso viel beigetragen wie f쬦 die Wirtschaft, was eine enorme Leistung darstellt.

column3: Tanzimat' Turkish for 'reorganization' was a series of reforms enacted by the Ottoman state during the latter half of the 19th century, designed to counteract the rising tides of nationalism among the Empire's vast and varied ethnic minorities. The reforms aimed at integrating the various populations under the common banner of 'Ottomanism', by promoting the Ottoman state as an alternative to the ethnicity based nation states that many of the radicalized minorities within the state were, at the time, seeking to establish, and by granting increased representation and autonomy within the state. While the Tanzimat was ultimately unsuccessful in preventing the decline of the Ottoman state, it can nevertheless be argued that the reforms at least postponed it.

column3: Edgardo Mortara was born to Jewish parents in Bologna in 1851. During a period of illness in 1857, a Catholic servant girl of the Mortara family baptized Edgardo, for fear that he might otherwise, as a non-christian, go to Hell if he died. On the basis of this baptism, the Papal States' police took Edgardo away from his family, and had him raised as a Roman Catholic, as non-christians were, according to Papal States' law, forbidden to raise Christian children, even their own. The case, or kidnapping, caused an international uproar, and was protested by, among others, Napoleon III, Emperor Franz Josef and The London Times. Mortara himself would go on to become a Catholic priest, and resumed contact with his siblings and mother in his later life.

column3: The Congo Conference, also known as the 'Berlin Conference', was an international conference held in 1884 at the initiative of German Chancellor Otto Graf von Bismarck. column3: A common name for Africa prior to its exploration, 'the Dark Continent' referred to the deep interior where few men had ever seen much less knew anything about. column2: 19세기에 이루어진 극적인 사회적, 경제적, 정치적 변혁과 산업시대의 대규모전쟁으로 인한 황폐화의 결합은 많은 지식인들 사이에 전체적인 사회구조가 포위돼 완전히 파괴될 위험에 처해있다는 위기감을 야기했습니다. 오스왈드 스펜글러는 1911년 새로운 사회, 정치, 경제적 세력의 도전이 선진산업사회의 중심을 흔들던 1911년 서구의 쇠퇴에 대한 연구를 시작했습니다. 스펜글러는 사회가 경험하는 것이 문명의 자연순환의 일부라고 결론지었습니다. 인간의 이성을 이용해 현대적 산업사회를 지속적으로 개선할 수 있다는 빅토리아시대적 사상에 대한 직접적인 도전이었습니다. 미국의 작가 거트루드 스타인이 쓴 이 작품은 많은 세계대전 참전용사들이 전쟁터의 학살에서 살아남은 후 느꼈던 상실감과 공허함을 포착하고 그들의 국가들이 분쟁에 참여하도록 장려했던 가치와 신념에 대해 애당초 의문을 품었습니다. 스펜글러와 울프가 발전시킨 이러한 쇠퇴와 상실이라는 테마는 20세기 초에 문화 지형을 지배할 것입니다.
column3: The combination of the dramatic social, economic and political transformations undertaken in the nineteenth century with the rise of industry and the devastation produced by mass warfare in the industrial age created a crisis of confidence among many intellectuals that the whole structure of society was under siege and in danger of complete collapse. Oswald Spengler began work on 밫he Decline Of The West쬦in 1911 as the challenges of new social, political and economic forces were shaking advanced industrial societies to their cores, with Spengler concluding that what these societies were experiencing was part of the natural cycle of civilizations that rise, have a period of brilliance, and eventually decline and collapse  a direct challenge to the Victorian idea that modern industrial society could continually be improved as a result of humanity뭩 rational abilities. Coined by American author Gertrude Stein, 밫he Lost Generation쬦captured the sense of loss and emptiness that many veterans of Great War felt after surviving the carnage of the battlefields and questioning the values and beliefs that had encouraged their nations to participate in the conflicts in the first place. These themes of decline and loss that Spengler and Woolf developed would dominate the cultural landscape in the early twentieth century.
column5: Die Kombination der dramatischen sozialen, wirtschaftlichen und politischen Transformationen des neunzehnten Jahrhunderts mit der Industrialisierung und den Schrecken der Vernichtungskriege des Industriezeitalters f쬦rte bei vielen Intellektuellen zu einer Bewusstseinskrise. Sie f쬦chteten, die Struktur der Gesellschaft werde belagert und st쬦de kurz vor dem Zusammenbruch. Oswald Spengler begann im Jahr 1911 mit der Arbeit an seinem Werk 밆er Untergang des Abendlandes쬦 als die neuen sozialen, politischen und wirtschaftlichen Kr쬦te die fortschrittlichen Industriegesellschaften in ihren Grundfesten ersch쬦terten. Spengler schloss daraus, dass das, was diesen Gesellschaften widerfuhr, Teil des nat쬦lichen Zyklus von Zivilisationen sei, bestehend aus Aufstieg, Bl쬦ezeit, Abstieg und schlie쬦ich Zusammenbruch  eine direkte Herausforderung des viktorianischen Gedankens, dass die moderne Industriegesellschaft aufgrund der rationalen F쬦igkeiten des Menschen fortw쬦rend verbessert werden kann. Das Verlustgef쬦l und die Leere, die viele Weltkriegsveteranen nach dem Gemetzel sp쬦ten und nun folgerichtig die Werte und Vorstellungen in Frage stellten, die ihre Nationen eigentlich erst zur Kriegsteilnahme bewogen hatten, wurde von der amerikanischen Autorin Gertrude Stein mit dem Ausdruck 밫he Lost Generation쬦gepr쬦t. Die von Spengler und Woolf entwickelte Niedergangs- und Verlustthematik sollte die kulturelle Landschaft des fr쬦en zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts dominieren.
column7: La combinaci쬦 de las dram쬦icas transformaciones sociales, econ쬦icas y pol쬦icas vividas en el siglo XIX con el ascenso de la industrializaci쬦 y la devastaci쬦 producida por la guerra en la era industrial provoc쬦una crisis de confianza entre muchos intelectuales, que llegaron a la conclusi쬦 de que la estructura entera de la sociedad estaba bajo asedio y se enfrentaba a la posibilidad de un colapso total. Oswald Spengler comenz쬦a trabajar en 뱇a decadencia de occidente쬦en 1911, cuando los desaf쬦s de las nuevas fuerzas sociales, pol쬦icas y econ쬦icas estaban removiendo hasta los cimientos las sociedades industrializadas. La conclusi쬦 de Spengler fue que lo que estaban viviendo era una fase del ciclo natural de vida las civilizaciones (nacimiento, periodo de brillantez y, finalmente, declive y colapso), un concepto que entraba en contradicci쬦 directa con la idea victoriana de que la sociedad industrial podr쬦 seguir progresando continuamente gracias al racionalismo del ser humano. Acu쬦do por la escritora estadounidense Gertrude Stein, el t쬦mino de 밽eneraci쬦 perdida쬦englobaba la sensaci쬦 de p쬦dida y vac쬦 que embarg쬦a numerosos veteranos de la Gran Guerra tras haber sobrevivido a la carnicer쬦 de los campos de batalla y los llev쬦a cuestionarse los valores y creencias que hab쬦n impulsado a sus pa쬦es a participar en el conflicto. Las ideas del declive y la p쬦dida desarrolladas por Spengler y Stein continuar쬦n dominando el paisaje cultural occidental durante la primera parte del siglo XX.

column2: 20세기 초 사회의 기초였던 방임자본주의를 대체하는 잠재적인 모델로 혁명적 공산주의가 확산됐습니다. 그러한 상황 속에서 우파들은 상류층과 중류층의 힘과 지위를 약화하는 사회혁명을 치루지 않고 방임자본주의의 문제점을 보완하는 제3의 대안을 제시하는 새로운 정치 모델을 모색했습니다. 이들의 노력은 1920년대 초반에 파쇼주의의 탄생이라는 형태로 결실을 맺었습니다. 파쇼주의은 공산주의만큼 철저하게 정의되지 않습니다. 그러나 파쇼주의 역시 국가/국민 전체의 이익을 위해 국가의 재편이 필요하다는 생각은 모두 같았습니다. 재편을 통해 국가공동체의 일원인 사람은 누구든지 경제적 지위에 관계없이 평등하게 산업사회의 혜택을 누릴 수 있으리라 생각했습니다. 이 사상은 외국과 세계의 권익과 영향력을 둘러싼 싸움에 승리하고, 국민 전체의 요구를 짐작해 국가를 통치하는 단일정당의 통치 하에 개인의 욕망이나 이해를 국가 목표로 설정하고 달성하려 했습니다. 1930년대 초, 이탈리아의 지오반니 젠틸레가 저서에서 예상한 바처럼 파쇼주의은 방임자본주의와 공산주의를 제외한 제3의 대안으로서 20세기 전반에 급속히 확산됐습니다.
column3: The spread of revolutionary Communism in the early twentieth century as a potential alternative model to Liberal Capitalism as the basis of the organization of society would lead to the development of new models on the political Right that sought to offer a third alternative that would replace the weaknesses inherent in Liberal Capitalist systems without promoting a social revolution that would dispossess the power and status of the upper and middle classes. By the early 1920s such a model would crystallize in the evolution of Fascism. Although less rigorously defined in terms of ideological content than Communism, Fascism at its base called for the reorganization of The State for the benefit of The Nation as a whole, so that all who are defined as members of the national community, regardless of socioeconomic class, receive the benefits of modern industrial society. This would be achieved by subsuming the desires and concerns of the individual to the needs of the Nation under the leadership of a single party that would govern according to the needs of the Nation as a whole and prepare the Nation to compete successfully with other nations for power and influence in the world. Fully elaborated in the writings of the Italian Giovanni Gentile in the early 1930s, Fascism as an alternative to both Liberal Capitalism and Communism would grow rapidly in the early twentieth century.
column5: Die Verbreitung des revolution쬦en Kommunismus Anfang des zwanzigsten Jahrhunderts als potentielles Alternativmodell zum Liberalkapitalismus als Grundlage der gesellschaftlichen Organisation f쬦rte zur Entwicklung neuer Modelle durch die politische Rechte. Diese wollte eine dritte Alternative anbieten, die die inh쬦ente Schw쬦he von Liberalkapitalismussystemen beseitigen sollte, ohne dabei eine soziale Revolution zu f쬦dern, die der Ober- und Mittelschicht Macht und Status aberkannt h쬦te. In den fr쬦en 1920er Jahren sollte sich so ein Modell in Form des Faschismus herauskristallisieren. Obwohl der Faschismus bez쬦lich des ideologischen Inhalts weniger rigoros formuliert war als der Kommunismus, war eine seiner Hauptforderungen die Neuorganisation des Staats zum Vorteil der gesamten Nation. So sollte gew쬦rleistet werden, dass alle definierten Mitglieder der nationalen Gemeinschaft ungeachtet ihrer sozial쬦onomischen Klasse von den Vorz쬦en der modernen Industriegesellschaft profitierten. Dies sollte durch die Subsumierung der W쬦sche und Sorgen des Individuums unter die Bed쬦fnisse der Nation und F쬦rung einer einzelnen Partei erreicht werden, die die Nation gem癌 ihrer Bed쬦fnisse als Einheit regieren und sie zum erfolgreichen Wettstreit um Macht und Einfluss mit anderen Nationen vorbereiten w쬦de. Der Faschismus wurde Anfang der 1930er Jahre in den Schriften des Italieners Giovanni Gentile in vollem Umfang als Alternative f쬦 Liberalkapitalismus und Kommunismus ausgearbeitet, und erfreute sich im fr쬦en zwanzigsten Jahrhundert wachsender Beliebtheit.
column7: El ascenso del comunismo revolucionario a comienzos del siglo XX como alternativa potencial de organizaci쬦 social al capitalismo liberal conducir쬦 al nacimiento de nuevos modelos en el campo de la derecha, modelos que buscar쬦n ofrecer una tercera alternativa capaz de reemplazar la debilidad inherente a los sistemas capitalistas, sin promover una revoluci쬦 que arrebatara el poder y el estatus a las clases media y alta. A comienzos de los a쬦s 20, estas tendencias cristalizar쬦n en el nacimiento del fascismo. Aunque menos riguroso en t쬦minos ideol쬦icos que el comunismo, el fascismo buscaba la reorganizaci쬦 del estado en beneficio de la naci쬦 en su conjunto, de modo que todos los miembros de la comunidad nacional, independientemente de su clase socioecon쬦ica, recibieran los beneficios de la sociedad industrializada moderna. Esto se conseguir쬦 sometiendo los deseos y preocupaciones de los individuos a las necesidades de la naci쬦, bajo el liderazgo de un solo partido capaz de gobernar pensando en las necesidades de esta y de prepararla para competir con 쬦ito con otras por el poder y la influencia mundiales. Elaborado en su totalidad por los escritos del italiano Giovanni Gentile a comienzos de los 30, el fascismo, como alternativa al capitalismo y al comunismo, experimentar쬦 un acelerado crecimiento en los primeros a쬦s del siglo.

column2: 1868년 교황 피오 9세는 천주교 제20차 기독교회의를 소집했습니다. 자유주의, 합리주의, 물질주의라는 현대적 이념을 다루는 동시에 천주교의 독단성을 더 정의하기 위함이었습니다. 신생국 이탈리아 왕국에게 로마가 점령당해 공의회가 짧게 끊긴 반면, 교황이 공식화한 불변적 가톨릭 신학은 지속적인 인상을 남겼습니다.
column3: In 1868, Pope Piux IX convened the 20th ecumenical council of the Roman Catholic Church. The council was convened to address the perceived problems of the modern ideologies of liberalism, rationalism and materialism, as well as to further define Catholic dogma. While the council was cut short by the capture of Rome by the newly formed Kingdom of Italy, it still left a lasting impression on Catholic theology in the form of the formalized Dogma of Papal Infallibility.

Interrompu par la prise de Rome par le nouveau royaume d'Italie, ce concile marqua n쬦nmoins durablement la th쬦logie catholique avec le dogme de l'infaillibilit쬦pontificale.
column5: Im Jahr 1868 berief Papst Piux IX. das 20. 쬦umenische Konzil der r쬦isch-katholischen Kirche ein. Das Konzil wurde einberufen, um 쬦er die Probleme der modernen Ideologien Liberalismus, Rationalismus und Materialismus zu diskutieren, und um das katholische Dogma tiefergehend zu definieren. Obwohl das Konzil durch die Eroberung Roms durch das neu gegr쬦dete K쬦igreich Italien abrupt endete, hatte es durch das formalisierte Dogma der p쬦stlichen Unfehlbarkeit dennoch bleibende Auswirkungen auf die katholische Ideologie.

El concilio fue convocado para atender los problemas detectados de las ideolog쬦s modernas del liberalismo, el racionalismo y el materialismo, adem쬦 de definir m쬦 espec쬦icamente el dogma cat쬦ico. Aunque el concilio se vio interrumpido por la captura de Roma por el Reino de Italia, dej쬦una huella perdurable en la teolog쬦 cat쬦ica a trav쬦 del dogma formalizado de la infalibilidad papal.

column2: 사회정책을 결정하는 수단으로서 보통선거제도의 확립을 향한 움직임은 사람들에게 민주주의에 따른 대중들의 고충과 우려에 대한 최종적 해결책으로 나아간다는 기대감을 안겨줍니다. 그러나 보통선거 제도가 확립되고 정당정치가 발전하면서 정당 간, 정당 내의 정치적 투쟁에 기인하는 혼란이 눈에 띄게 되고, 이윽고 사회권력 중재제도로서의 자유민주주의의 한계가 드러나고 맙니다. (이것은 사회, 경제, 그리고 정치적 위기 때 특히 눈에 띕니다) 그렇게 되면 사람들은 민주주의적 이상에 환멸을 느끼며 더 효율적이고 더 나은 삶을 보장해줄 다른 정치체제를 갈망하기 시작합니다. 1930년 에스파냐의 철학자 호세 오르테가 이 가세트는 '대중의 반역'을 집필해 자유민주주의의 한계가 일으키는 잠재적 위협을 경고했습니다. 그는 대중정치로 인한 의심에 충분히 부응하도록 자유민주주의가 변화하지 않는다면, 현재의 정치제도를 타도하고 다른 대안을 원하는 대중들이 자유민주주의의 기본 원칙을 파괴할 가능성이 있다고 지적했습니다.
column3: The move towards the establishment of universal suffrage as the basis for determining the balance of political power in society led to an increased sense of hope that with democracy the issues and concerns of The People would finally be addressed. The resulting factionalism caused by the growth of political parties in wake of universal suffrage soon exposed the limitations of liberal democracy as a system for the arbitration of power in society (especially in times of social, economic or political crisis) and led to a great deal of disenchantment with the ideals of democracy as the best system of governance and a search for potential alternatives to more effectively achieve the promises of a better life for all. Written in 1930 by the Spanish intellectual Jose Ortega y Gasset, 밫he Revolt Of The Masses쬦warns of the potential threat to the ideal of liberal democracy in its current limitations and the potential for the masses to overwhelm the political system and replace it with alternatives that in the end would destroy the basic principles of classic liberal democracy unless liberal democracy was able to reform itself to meet the challenges produced by mass politics.
column5: Der Schritt in Richtung der Einf쬦rung des universalen Wahlrechts als Grundlage zur Bestimmung des politischen Machtgef쬦es innerhalb der Gesellschaft f쬦rte zu steigenden Hoffnungen darauf, dass mit der Einf쬦rung der Demokratie die Probleme und Sorgen des Volks endlich geh쬦t werden w쬦den. Dies f쬦rte vielfach dazu, dass sich die Menschen von den demokratischen Idealen stark entt쬦scht zeigten und die Demokratie nicht mehr als das beste Regierungssystem ansahen. column7: La tendencia hacia el establecimiento del sufragio universal como base para determinar el equilibrio del poder pol쬦ico en la sociedad aliment쬦la esperanza de que, con la democracia, los problemas y preocupaciones de las masas pudieran resolverse por fin. column2: '백인의 짐'은 1899년에 출판된 영국 시인 러디어드 키플링의 시입니다. 비록 제국주의에 대한 침울한 경고와 제국주의를 향한 권고를 섞었음에도 불구하고, 백인의 지배와 식민화를 열심히 포장했습니다. 제국주의자들은 '백인의 짐'이라는 문구를 식민정책을 정당화하는 제국주의의 특징으로 이해하게 됐습니다.
column3: 'The White Man's Burden' was a poem by the English poet Rudyard Kipling, published in 1899. At face value it appeared to be a rhetorical command to white men to colonise and rule other nations for the benefit of those people (both the people and the duty may be seen as representing the 'burden' of the title), even though it mixed its  exhortation to empire with somber warnings of the costs involved in imperialism. Imperialists came to understand the phrase 'white man's burden' as a characterization for imperialism that justified the policy as a noble enterprise.

column3: Thomas Brown was an associationist of the Scottish School, he added a secondary set of laws to complete the associationist philosophy.
